Name: Lufthansa
Company description: Lufthansa is one of the world's largest and most prestigious airlines. With hubs in Frankfurt and Munich, we currently fly to 211 destinations in 74 countries. As an industry innovator, we have long been committed to environmental care and sustainability, operating one of the most technologically-advanced and fuel-efficient fleets in the world. Our long-haul fleet includes the Boeing 747-8 and the Airbus A350-900, which are some of the most environmentally-friendly passenger aircraft in the aviation industry. Known for our premium services, we have recently been named ‚ÄúEurope‚Äôs best airline‚Äù by Skytrax and continue to build new or upgrade existing lounge facilities across our worldwide network. Our entire long-haul fleet features all new onboard products in each class‚Äì bringing us one step closer to becoming the first five-star airline in the Western Hemisphere. Additionally, the entire Lufthansa long-haul fleet is equipped with our onboard broadband wireless Internet service, FlyNet. For more information, reservations or customer service, visit lufthansa.com or follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Snapchat. We look forward to welcoming you onboard. This LinkedIn page is maintained by Deutsche Lufthansa AG. We will not answer specific Customer Service queries here on LinkedIn. If you have an immediate concern or need to contact us please visit http://www.lufthansa.com/us/en/imprint

Name: Lufthansa CityLine GmbH
Company description: Lufthansa CityLine ist eine hundertprozentige Konzerngesellschaft der Deutschen Lufthansa AG. Rund 8,2 Millionen Passagiere fliegen zurzeit pro Jahr mit Lufthansa CityLine. Unsere Flotte besteht aus modernen und umweltfreundlichen Flugzeugen der Typen Embraer 190, Bombardier CRJ900, Airbus A319, Airbus A320neo sowie Airbus A321P2F. Lufthansa CityLine besch√§ftigt rund 2.250 Mitarbeiter in den Bereichen Cockpit und Kabine, sowie am Boden in den Bereichen Technik und Verwaltung. Mit 330 Fl√ºgen t√§glich zu rund 80 Zielorten bietet Lufthansa CityLine schnelle und bequeme Nonstop-Verbindungen von und zu den Hubs Frankfurt und M√ºnchen.

Name: KLM Royal Dutch Airlines
Company description: Welcome to our LinkedIn page! KLM was founded in 1919 and is the oldest airline in the world. With a vast network of European and intercontinental destinations, KLM can offer direct flights to major cities and economic centres all over the world.  Through our LinkedIn account, we make sure you are kept up-to-date about KLM and other developments in the air transport industry.  For all COVID information, please see https://klmf.ly/COVID19. See all our community standards here: https://social.klm.com/standards

Name: Ryanair Holdings plc
Company description: Catch flights, not feelings üíÖ Ryanair Holdings plc, Europe‚Äôs largest airline group, is the parent company of Ryanair DAC, Lauda, Buzz and Ryanair UK. Carrying 160m+ guests p.a. on over 3,000 daily flights to/from 225 airports. Plan to carry 225m+ guests p.a. by 2026.  Unfortunately, we are unable to answer customer service queries through LinkedIn.  Please contact our customer service department through our website: http://www.ryanair.com/ie/questions/contacting-customer-service/ alternatively you can contact us through Twitter @askRyanair or on facebook.com/Ryanair

Name: TAP Air Portugal
HQ Location: Portugal, Lisbon, Lisbon, 25 Rua C Edf.
Company description: TAP is a Portuguese airline market leader, founded in 1945. The airline is a member of the Star Alliance, the largest global alliance of airlines in the world. With its Hub in Lisbon - a privileged access platform to Europe ‚Äì at the crossroad with other Continents, the Company currently flies to Africa, North and South America; a region in which TAP stands out as being the leading operational European transportation company to Brazil. Continuing a strategic direction whose priority is Client expectation satisfaction, TAP continuously seeks to provide its clients with the best and easiest solutions for their trips, continuously adding additional value to the product they offer. With this objective, the Company also establishes the best of partnerships, on land and in the air; offering, thus, an increased number of destinations served in code-share with similar companies, in addition to a diversified group of advantages and associated fringe benefits. TAP intends to turn itself into, ever more, a reference airline on the international scene, taking advantage of business opportunities of markets in which it competes and differentiating itself with its operational efficiency and quality of service. The Company aims to build, at every moment the best choice for its client‚Äôs trips, as well as to assure its Shareholders with the most adequate levels of profitability and its employees with the best conditions of professional development.

Name: Iberia
Company description: Iberia is Spain's leading airline, renowned for its extensive domestic and international flight services. The company is committed to enhancing air travel through innovative solutions, including the integration of cloud technology and artificial intelligence to improve customer experience. With a mission to achieve annual profitability between 13.5% and 15% by 2030, Iberia is investing ‚Ç¨6 billion in its strategic flight plan, which aims to adapt to evolving market demands and customer needs. The airline serves a diverse clientele, including business travelers and leisure passengers, and has established partnerships with various organizations, such as the National Transplant Organization, to facilitate critical services like organ transport. Iberia's target market encompasses both individual travelers and corporate clients, with tailored offerings like the Iberia Club loyalty program and specialized air shuttle services between major cities.

Name: Alitalia Societ√† Aerea Italiana S.p.A.
Company description: Alitalia - Societ√† Aerea Italiana is the leading Italian airline. During 2019, Alitalia transported 21.3 million passengers and has one of the most efficient fleets, featuring long-haul aircraft (Boeing 777-300 ER, Boeing 777-200 ER, Airbus A330-200), medium-haul aircraft (Airbus A321, Airbus A320, Airbus A319) and regional aircraft (Embraer 190 and Embraer 175).  On long haul-flights, Alitalia offers three service classes: Magnifica, Premium Economy and Economy.  In 2019, Alitalia received two awards from the respected American magazine Global Traveler: "Best Airline Cuisine" for the tenth consecutive edition and, for the second time, the "Best Business-Class Seat Design". The comfort of the armchair and the quality of the meals served on board make the Magnifica class travel experience even more unique.  Alitalia is also a member of the global SkyTeam alliance.

Name: Vueling Airlines
HQ Location: Spain, Catalonia, Viladecans, 83 Carrer De Catalunya, 08840
Company description: Vueling, part of IAG and celebrating its 20th anniversary in 2024, is one of the main low-cost airlines in Europe and a key carrier in Spain.  It is the leading airline operating from its main base at Barcelona-El Prat, as well as in other important markets in Spain, such as Bilbao. It is also the leading airline between mainland Spain and the Balearic and Canary Islands. Internationally, it is working to strengthen its presence in major hubs such as London-Gatwick, Paris-Orly, Amsterdam, Florence and Rome.  With more than 4,600 employees, Vueling is the first airline in Europe to be certified as a Top Employer.  Mission: We love connecting people and places, creating value for our shareholders, employees, customers, and society while building a sustainable future. Vision: Together we will be the leading LCC in all the markets we choose to serve by unlocking our full potential through Vueling Transform.

Name: Wizz Air Holdings Plc
Company description: At WIZZ, we believe that affordable travel provides the opportunities that can change people and the world around us for the better. Wizz Air is one of the leading low-cost airlines in Europe and the largest in Central and Eastern Europe. Founded in 2004, Wizz Air carried more than 34 million passengers in 2018 and continues to grow, adding new countries, new destinations and new opportunities to travel. Wizz Air flies to 44 countries and counts on more than 4,500 enthusiastic aviation professionals from more than 50 countries ‚Äì pilots, cabin crew, operations, administration, sales, marketing and communications for the company‚Äôs success. Visit the Careers section at wizzair.com (https://wizzair.com/en-GB/career) to learn about exciting opportunities to join the WIZZ team.

Name: Condor Flugdienst GmbH
Company description: Condor Flugdienst GmbH is a prominent German airline specializing in leisure travel, offering flights to various destinations worldwide. Founded in 1955, the company has evolved into a key player in the tourism sector, known for its commitment to customer satisfaction and innovative services. Condor's mission extends beyond providing air travel; it actively participates in social initiatives, such as the FlyPink campaign, which raises awareness and supports breast cancer research and prevention. The airline caters to a diverse clientele, including vacationers and business travelers, and partners with various organizations to enhance its service offerings. With a modern fleet, including the latest Airbus A330neo aircraft, Condor aims to deliver exceptional comfort and efficiency while expanding its reach in the North American market and beyond.

Name: SAS - Scandinavian Airlines
Company description: SAS - Scandinavian Airlines is the leading airline in Scandinavia, providing a comprehensive range of air travel services to destinations across Europe, Asia, and North America. With a mission to offer a seamless and comfortable travel experience, SAS prioritizes customer satisfaction through innovative services such as online check-in, seat selection, and loyalty programs like EuroBonus. The airline caters to a diverse clientele, including business travelers and vacationers, and partners with various global airlines to enhance connectivity and service offerings. SAS aims to be a sustainable airline, focusing on reducing its environmental impact while delivering high-quality service to its passengers. With a strong presence in major cities like London, Berlin, and Copenhagen, SAS is committed to making air travel accessible and enjoyable for all.

Name: Austrian Airlines
Company description: Austrian Airlines is the flag carrier of Austria, providing a comprehensive range of air travel services to both domestic and international destinations. The airline is committed to delivering a high-quality travel experience, focusing on convenience and efficiency, as demonstrated by its organized boarding process that prioritizes families, passengers with reduced mobility, and frequent flyers. Austrian Airlines aims to connect people and cultures while ensuring customer satisfaction through its attentive service and modern fleet. The airline primarily serves business and leisure travelers, partnering with various global airlines as a member of the Star Alliance network to enhance connectivity and offer a seamless travel experience. With a strong presence in Europe and beyond, Austrian Airlines targets a diverse clientele, including tourists, business professionals, and expatriates.

Name: Finnair
Company description: Founded in 1923, Finnair is one of the world‚Äôs oldest operating airlines. We are a network airline specialised in connecting Europe, North America and Asia via our transfer-friendly Helsinki hub ‚Äì our purpose is to enrich life by bridging the world. Sustainability is at the core of our strategy. Our long-term target is carbon neutrality: we want to maintain the social and economic benefits enabled by air connections, while dramatically reducing the carbon footprint of air travel. For more information on Finnair, please refer to www.company.finnair.com or www.finnair.com.

Name: Eurowings
Company description: Eurowings is Germany's largest leisure airline and a subsidiary of the Lufthansa Group, dedicated to providing affordable air travel options across Europe and beyond. The airline specializes in direct flights to over 150 destinations in 39 countries, with a particular focus on popular vacation spots in southern Europe and an expanding presence in the Gulf region. Eurowings' mission is to make flying accessible to everyone while ensuring a high-quality travel experience, which is reflected in its diverse range of in-flight services, including fresh and locally sourced meals. The airline targets both leisure and business travelers, offering tailored services through its EW4Business program, which provides corporate discounts for small and medium-sized enterprises. In addition to its core flight services, Eurowings has launched Eurowings Holidays, a tour operator that offers customized holiday packages, enhancing the travel experience for its extensive customer base. The airline is committed to sustainability, actively working to reduce its carbon footprint through the modernization of its fleet and the use of sustainable aviation fuels. Eurowings aims to use 100% environmentally friendly packaging and reduce food waste by half by 2025, reinforcing its dedication to environmental responsibility. Eurowings collaborates with various partners, including airports and tourism boards, to enhance its service offerings and expand its market reach. The airline has been recognized with a four-star rating from Skytrax, reflecting its commitment to customer satisfaction and operational excellence. By investing in fuel-efficient aircraft and promoting sustainable practices, Eurowings strives to make flying more eco-friendly while contributing positively to climate protection efforts. With a focus on customer satisfaction and a broad target market, Eurowings is positioned as a key player in the European aviation market, catering to budget-conscious travelers seeking convenient and eco-friendly flight options.

Name: Norwegian
Company description: Norwegian Air Shuttle ASA, commonly known as Norwegian, is a prominent low-cost airline headquartered in Fornebu, Norway. The airline specializes in providing affordable air travel options across Europe and beyond, operating a modern fleet of 135 aircraft, including the latest Boeing 737 MAX 8. Norwegian's mission is to serve people the Norwegian way, with a vision to become the most loved and trusted airline in Europe, emphasizing customer satisfaction, operational performance, and sustainability. The airline caters to a diverse clientele, including leisure travelers, business professionals, and families, and has recently expanded its operations through the acquisition of Wider√∏e, enhancing its service offerings and route network. Norwegian is committed to sustainability, aiming for carbon neutrality by 2050 and actively investing in modern aircraft and biofuels to reduce emissions. The company has set ambitious targets, including a 45% reduction in carbon intensity by 2030 compared to 2010 levels, and is focused on integrating sustainable aviation fuels into its operations. Norwegian's loyalty program, Norwegian Reward, boasts over four million members, allowing customers to earn and redeem points for flights and services, further enhancing the travel experience. The airline collaborates with various partners in the travel and tourism sectors, including hotels and car rental services, to provide comprehensive travel solutions. Norwegian prioritizes transparency and ethical business practices, ensuring compliance with international regulations and fostering a positive workplace culture for its over 8,700 employees. With a strong financial platform and a focus on innovation, Norwegian aims to navigate the challenges of the aviation industry while creating long-term value for its stakeholders and contributing positively to the communities it serves.

Name: LOT Polish Airlines
Company description: LOT Polish Airlines, established in 1929, is the flag carrier and largest airline in Poland, recognized as one of the oldest airlines in the world. The company operates a comprehensive network of domestic and international flights, connecting passengers to over 100 destinations across Europe, North America, and Asia. LOT's mission is to provide high-quality air travel services while ensuring safety, comfort, and customer satisfaction. The airline aims to be a leader in the Central and Eastern European aviation market, focusing on innovation and sustainability in its operations.  LOT caters to a diverse clientele, including business travelers, tourists, and families, as well as cargo services. The airline's partnerships with various global airlines, particularly as a member of the Star Alliance, enhance connectivity and travel options for its customers. With a commitment to excellence, LOT Polish Airlines continuously evolves to meet the changing needs of its passengers and the aviation industry.  The airline is dedicated to enhancing the travel experience through modern aircraft, in-flight entertainment, and exceptional service. Additionally, LOT is actively working on strategies to reduce its carbon footprint and promote sustainable aviation practices, reflecting its commitment to environmental responsibility. By promoting Polish culture and tourism globally, LOT Polish Airlines not only connects Poland with the world but also plays a vital role in the growth of the aviation sector in the region.

Name: BINTER CANARIAS
HQ Location: Spain, Canary Islands, Las Palmas De Gran Canaria
Company description: Binter Canarias is a regional airline that commenced operations on March 26, 1989, focusing on providing air connectivity between the islands of the Canary archipelago. With a commitment to sustainability and customer satisfaction, Binter aims to connect emotions and enhance travel experiences for its passengers. The airline has established itself as a vital link for both residents and visitors, offering direct flights to various destinations, including a notable route between Santander and the Canary Islands, which has seen significant growth in passenger numbers. Binter's mission revolves around delivering exceptional service while fostering a sustainable future, making it a preferred choice for travelers in the region. The company collaborates with various partners to ensure seamless travel experiences and caters to a diverse clientele, including tourists and local residents seeking reliable air travel options.

Name: Transavia
HQ Location: Netherlands, North Holland, Schiphol, 15 Piet Guilonardweg, 1117ee
Company description: Transavia is a low-cost airline founded in 1965, with a commitment to providing affordable and accessible air travel to over 110 destinations across Europe and North Africa. Operating from bases in the Netherlands and France, Transavia aims to make flying enjoyable and budget-friendly for both leisure and business travelers. The airline's mission is to ensure that every passenger can find a flight that fits their budget, while its vision focuses on enhancing the travel experience through reliable service and digital accessibility. Transavia caters to a diverse clientele, including families, solo travelers, and business professionals, and partners with various travel service providers to offer comprehensive travel solutions, including hotel bookings and car rentals. With a strong emphasis on customer satisfaction, Transavia continues to innovate and adapt to the evolving needs of its passengers.

Name: Iberia Express
Company description: Iberia Express is a low-cost airline that operates as a subsidiary of Iberia, focusing on providing affordable air travel options primarily within Europe and to select destinations in North Africa. The company aims to deliver a seamless travel experience, emphasizing punctuality and customer satisfaction, as evidenced by its recognition as the most punctual low-cost airline for five consecutive years. Iberia Express caters to a diverse clientele, including leisure travelers and business professionals, and partners with various travel platforms to enhance its service offerings. The airline's mission is to make air travel accessible and enjoyable, while its vision includes leveraging digital transformation to improve customer engagement and streamline operations. With features like the Club Express Onboard, Iberia Express enhances the in-flight experience by providing entertainment options and exclusive discounts for its members.

Name: VistaJet
Company description: VistaJet is the first and only global aviation company. On its fleet of silver and red business jets, VistaJet has flown corporations, governments and private clients to 187 countries, covering 96% of the world.  Founded in 2004 by Thomas Flohr, the company pioneered an innovative business model where customers have access to an entire fleet whilst paying only for the hours they fly, free of the responsibilities and asset risks linked to aircraft ownership.  VistaJet‚Äôs signature Program membership offers customers a bespoke subscription of flight hours on its fleet of mid and long-range jets, to fly them anytime, anywhere. Customers can also request Direct one-off flights through the industry‚Äôs first end-to-end booking app or a 24/7 global team. More VistaJet information and news at vistajet.com

Name: KLM Cityhopper
Company description: KLM Cityhopper is a regional airline and a subsidiary of KLM Royal Dutch Airlines, specializing in short-haul flights across Europe. The company aims to enhance the travel experience by providing efficient and reliable air services, focusing on operational excellence and innovation in technology. KLM Cityhopper serves a diverse clientele, including business travelers and leisure passengers, and partners with various organizations to expand its network and improve service offerings. With a commitment to becoming the most data and technology-driven airline, KLM Cityhopper is dedicated to modernizing its operations and enhancing customer satisfaction through data-driven insights and agile methodologies. The airline's mission is to lead in quality and digital leadership within the aviation industry, ensuring a seamless travel experience for its customers.

Name: Portugalia Airlines
Company description: Even though it was created in 1988, the Company only began operating in 1990. The first official flight departs from Lisbon heading to Porto on July 7th of that same year, operated by a Fokker 100. With its internationalization in June 1992, and the acquisition of new aircraft, Portug√°lia Airlines asserted itself on the European market as a private and innovative airline, guided by high level service standards and recognized internationally (Best Regional Airline in Europe, 2001-2006, and the Skytrax Award for Best Cabin Staff in Europe, in 2005). In 2007, it integrates the TAP Group and takes on a new business model, working under a Group logic now. In 2016, the Company renewed its fleet, and is now operating with a fleet of 9 Embraer 190 and 4 Embraer 195, with a new image, an increase in passenger capacity and greater flexibility while maintaining the same consistency and service quality. The Company's aircraft now fly under the TAP express brand, supporting TAP's commitment to the regional market.

Name: Satair
Company description: Satair is an Airbus Services company offering first-class material management solutions in the aviation aftermarket industry. We take pride in delivering an excellent customer experience around the clock, driving innovation, and contributing to aviation‚Äôs digital and sustainable transformation.  As a subsidiary of Airbus, our wingspan extends across the globe, connecting OEMs and customers with an unparalleled range of genuine OEM parts and innovative multi-fleet services. We're not just a distributor; we're the heartbeat of material management, ensuring seamless access to Airbus Material Support and serving as the exclusive authorized distributor for an extensive array of Proprietary Products and Services, in collaboration with our trading partner, Airbus SAS. What truly sets us apart is our unwavering Can-Do Attitude. It's the beating heart of our company, driving us to embrace challenges with passion and persistence. We thrive on initiative, constantly seeking ways to elevate our business and exceed expectations. From aircraft hangars to the skies, Satair is committed to delivering excellence in every endeavor.

Name: Volotea
Company description: Volotea is a low-cost airline that specializes in connecting medium-sized European cities, offering affordable flights to a variety of destinations. The company aims to provide travelers with the best price guarantee while ensuring a convenient and enjoyable flying experience. Volotea's mission is to make air travel accessible to a broader audience, focusing on customer satisfaction through flexible booking options and a range of services, including their Combo packages that bundle various travel amenities at reduced rates. The airline primarily serves leisure travelers looking for budget-friendly options to explore popular European destinations, and it partners with local tourism boards to promote regional travel. With a commitment to operational efficiency and customer service, Volotea continues to expand its network, catering to a diverse clientele eager to discover new places.

Name: Air Atlanta
Company description: The Air Atlanta brand consists of two sister airlines, ‚ÄúAir Atlanta Icelandic‚Äù with headquarters in Iceland and ‚ÄúAir Atlanta Europe‚Äù in Malta. Operating a fleet of B747-400 and B777s, Air Atlanta has over its 39 year history, proven itself as one of the leading ACMI & Charter service provider in the world.   Committed to providing our customers around the world with exceptional ACMI-, Charter- and Aircraft Management services, the two sister airlines complement each other and benefit from shared ownership and the support and know-how of their senior management - which never compromises on safety-, operational- and quality standards.

Name: AeroLogic
Company description: Established in September 2007, AeroLogic's first plane took off in the summer of 2009 with the fleet eventually comprising 8 brand-new Boeing 777F's. The company is jointly owned by Deutsche Post DHL and Deutsche Lufthansa AG through their subsidiaries DHL Express and Lufthansa Cargo. The current AeroLogic fleet comprises 28 Boeing 777F.  AeroLogic GmbH is headquartered in Leipzig/Schkeuditz. The company has its own air operating certificate, its own traffic rights, and its own slots. It is responsible for aircraft, crews, route networks and all flight operations. Only cargo on AeroLogic flights will be allocated and processed directly by DHL Express and Lufthansa Cargo, using an innovative, sophisticated model designed to meet the needs of both partners.  For the shipper, AeroLogic means greater capacities, higher flight frequencies, and unmatched transit times for exchanging goods between Asia or North America and Europe ‚Äì in short, a route network optimised like none other.

Name: Czech Airlines
Company description: Czech Airlines is one of the oldest airlines in Europe.  We have provided services to passengers since 1923.  Right up to the present, we have gained an enormous amount of experience and have grown into a modern airline, boasting a number of awards for the quality of our services.

Name: RECARO Aircraft Seating
Company description: RECARO Aircraft Seating combines innovation with comfort since its founding in 1972. Today, the family-owned company is a leading supplier of premium seating solutions in the aviation industry for economy, premium and business class. Headquartered in Schwaebisch Hall, Germany, RECARO has a global presence in China, Poland, South Africa and the United States, with more than 2,900 employees and sales of approximately 576 million euros in 2024.  Executive Board: Dr. Mark Hiller (CEO), Peter M√ºller (CFO) General Manager RECARO Aircraft Seating Germany: Jochen Weidner

Name: AirBaltic
HQ Location: Latvia, Marupes District, 3 Tehnikas Iela, lv-1053
Company description: airBaltic is a strong and internationally respected airline with the main hub in Riga and bases in Tallinn and Vilnius. We're connecting the Baltic States to 80 destinations across Europe, the Middle East, North Africa, and the Caucasus region, providing essential infrastructure and global connectivity for the region.    The airline was founded in 1995. The hybrid strategy integrates the best practices of both traditional network airlines and low-cost carriers. airBaltic stands out as one of Europe's most punctual airlines and currently operates one of the world's youngest fleet ‚Äì Airbus A220-300 exclusively.   airBaltic's commitment to excellence is recognized by numerous prestigious awards, including being named the Best Airline in its region by Skytrax for three consecutive years.  In 2025, airBaltic made its debut in the global rankings compiled by Airline Ratings, which recognized it among the world‚Äôs 50 safest and overall best airlines, as well as one of the leading global airlines in sustainability and among the most preferred airlines in Europe and the UK.  The same year, APEX awarded the company the Five Star Major Airline Award for its commitment to providing a high-quality travel experience and before that ‚Äì the Passenger Choice Award for Best Cabin Service in Europe.    With a workforce exceeding 2800 talented individuals representing over 30 nationalities, airBaltic is not only expanding but also fostering diversity within its ranks. airBaltic proudly holds a position among the TOP3 most desired employers in Latvia, a testament to our positive reputation within the industry.

Name: TAROM
HQ Location: Romania, Ilfov, Otopeni-jud, No.224 F Calea Bucurestilor, 075150
Company description: TAROM Romanian Air Transport was established in 1954 and developed together with the Romanian aviation. TAROM is member of SkyTeam Alliance as of June 25th, 2010. The company operates on more than 60 own destinations as well as destinations operated by its code share partners. The Romanian flag carrier owns a fleet consisting of 25 aircraft and has been a member of the International Air Transport Association (IATA) since 1993 and of the Association of European Airlines (AEA) since 2000. TAROM is a modern and future-oriented company which is environmentally friendly by implementing innovative procedures to reduce carbon dioxide emissions.

Name: Air Nostrum
Company description: Air Nostrum is a regional airline based in Spain, primarily operating as a franchise partner of Iberia under the Iberia Regional brand. The company specializes in providing essential air transport services, connecting smaller cities and regions to major urban centers, thereby enhancing accessibility and mobility for passengers. Air Nostrum's mission is to deliver high-quality, reliable, and efficient air travel experiences while maintaining a strong commitment to safety and customer satisfaction. The airline serves a diverse clientele, including business travelers, tourists, and local residents, and collaborates with various partners in the aviation industry to expand its network and service offerings. With a focus on regional connectivity, Air Nostrum aims to support economic growth and tourism in the areas it serves.

Name: Air Dolomiti
Company description: Air Dolomiti is a regional airline based in Italy, operating as a subsidiary of Deutsche Lufthansa AG. The company specializes in providing air travel services to various European destinations, including major cities like Munich and Frankfurt. With a mission to deliver high-quality service and a commitment to environmental sustainability, Air Dolomiti aims to enhance the travel experience for both leisure and business travelers. The airline caters to a diverse clientele, including individual passengers and group travelers, while also partnering with travel agencies and corporate clients. Through its extensive network and tailored services, Air Dolomiti strives to meet the needs of its target market, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable journey for all its customers.

Name: Iran Air AT
Company description: Official page of Iran Air in Vienna, Austria.  Iran Air is the flag carrier of the Islamic Republic of Iran, offering direct flights between Vienna and Tehran since 1974.  Tickets can be booked through www.iranair.at. Follow us on social media to receive weekly updates from our sales team in the heart of Vienna‚Äôs city center. ‚Üí Opernring 1, 1010 Vienna.  instagram/iranairat facebook/iranairat

Name: ROMATSA
HQ Location: Romania, Bucure≈üti, Bucharest, 10 Ion Ionescu De La Brad Blvd Bucharest, 013813
Company description: Romanian Air Traffic Services Administration ‚Äì ROMATSA is a provider of ANS, which performs specific functions related to ATM to all GAT-IFR flights. It was established in December 1990 through a Decision of the Romanian Government, laying therefore under the authority of the Ministry of Transport and Infrastructure.  ROMATSA is certified in accordance with the Single European Sky Regulations by the Romanian Civil Aviation Authority to provide air traffic services (ATS), communication, navigation or surveillance services (CNS), aeronautical information services (AIS), meteorological services (MET), so as to provide local ASM (tactical/ASM Level 3) and local ATFM functions.  According to SES Regulations, ROMATSA is designated by the Ministry of Transport and Infrastructure to provide air traffic services (ATS) for general air traffic (GAT) and for meteorological services (MET) in FIR Bucuresti. The current designation was made as a result of the establishment, in December 2014, of two cross-border sectors within the DANUBE FAB airspace, which  demonstrates FAB‚Äôs continued commitment to the Single European Sky, and in particular the optimum use of airspace within FABs regardless of national boundaries of Romania and the Republic of Bulgaria.

Name: Aegean Airlines
Company description: For more than 25 years, AEGEAN, a member of Star Alliance, constitutes Greece‚Äôs largest airline, providing full service, premium quality short and medium haul services. In 2013 AEGEAN united its strength with Olympic Air; in order to become even better and to offer a wide-ranging network within Greece, as well as abroad supporting Greek regions and ensuring the qualitative access even to the most remote Greek island. AEGEAN connects every corner of Greece with 180 destinations, in 49 countries with 307 routes and a total fleet of 76 aircraft, including the brand-new Airbus A320 and A321 neo, by the end of 2023. The new aircraft facilitate new services for passengers, as well as increased range capabilities, enabling expansion to new destinations and markets. As an outcome in 2023 AEGEAN transferred almost 15.5M passengers, 3.2 million more compared to 2022, an increase of 26%, reaching a new record high. AEGEAN has been announced as the Best Regional Airline in Europe for the 12th consecutive year and 13th time in the last 14 years. Moreover, AEGEAN was named 3rd Best Regional Airline in the World, was ranked 10th in Europe for its cabin crew, was amongst the World's Top 100 Airlines for 2021 (36th) and was amongst the winners of the COVID-19 Airline Excellence Award 2021 category, that rate the COVID-19 standards and best practices for the health and safety measures applied for both passengers and crew on board and on the ground. For more information, visit aegeanair.com.

Name: Neos SpA
Company description: Neos SpA is an Italian airline that specializes in providing charter and scheduled flights to various international destinations. With a mission to deliver exceptional travel experiences, Neos aims to connect travelers with diverse cultures and locations while ensuring comfort and safety. The airline primarily serves leisure travelers, offering routes to popular holiday destinations across Europe, Africa, and Asia, including direct flights from major Italian airports. Neos collaborates with travel agencies and tour operators, making it a preferred choice for vacation packages. The company is committed to sustainability and innovation in the aviation sector, striving to enhance customer satisfaction through quality service and modern fleet management.

Name: Luxair

Name: Germania Airlines
Company description: More Than Three Million Germania Passengers a Year Germania is an independent German airline. It operates under its own name on a growing number of scheduled routes which can be booked directly. Germania also handles many flights on behalf of leading tour operators. Furthermore, Germania specializes in ad-hoc charters and event flights. The airline also operates staff shuttles on behalf of several European blue-chip companies. On short-haul and medium-haul flights the airline, with its distinctive green and white livery, carries more than 3 million passengers per year to holiday destinations, friends or family. Together with Germania Flug AG and Bulgarian Eagle, the company now operates 29 aircraft with a regional focus, outside major hubs. With its instinct for market opportunities, Germania has always offered flights to less conventional destinations. The airline‚Äòs route network includes more than 55 destinations in Europe, North Africa and the Middle East. Full service on board Germania is one of the few airlines within the holiday flight sector which continues to offer a full service on board: snacks, soft drinks and magazines are all included in the ticket price. Depending on the length of the flight, a warm meal is also served. All passengers benefit from a baggage allowance of 20 kg, and on longer flights ‚Äì for example to and from Beirut, Tehran and Tel Aviv ‚Äì the baggage allowance increases to 25 kg. Within Germania‚Äôs cabins, comfortable seats and innovative ambient lighting provide a pleasant flight experience. Prices for one-way flights start from as little as 59 Euros. Tickets can be bought on the internet at www.flygermania.com, by telephone on tel: +49 30 610 818 000 (prices apply to standard German telephone networks, mobile phone prices can vary) as well as through travel agents. All prices are inclusive of taxes and fees.

Name: Xfly

The company was established by the state owned Nordic Aviation Group AS back in 2015.  Xfly operates a fleet of 16 aircraft - modern CRJ700/900 and ATR72. We are also in the process of introducing E-Jets.  Outsourcing of regional production enables our customers to maintain efficiency in regional segment. It reduces the complexity of in-house production and gives a greater degree of flexibility and frees resources for maintaining and gaining market share.  Xfly provides customized solutions for capacity needs on medium and long-term contracts, ensuring strong service delivery and perceived quality for customer. Name: AESA - Agencia Estatal De Seguridad A√©rea
Company description: AESA - Agencia Estatal De Seguridad A√©rea is the Spanish governmental agency responsible for ensuring the safety and security of civil aviation. Its mission is to regulate and oversee aviation operations, particularly those classified as high-risk specialized commercial operations, such as parachuting and aerobatic flights. AESA collaborates with various ministries, including the Ministry of Transport and Sustainable Mobility and the Ministry of Defence, to maintain high safety standards in the aviation sector. The agency serves a diverse clientele, including national and international operators engaged in specialized aviation activities, ensuring compliance with European regulations. AESA's vision is to foster a safe and efficient air transport system that meets the needs of both operators and the public while promoting environmental sustainability.

Name: Volocopter
Company description: Volocopter is a pioneering company in the field of sustainable urban air mobility (UAM), dedicated to enhancing the quality of life in megacities through innovative transportation solutions. Founded in 2011, the company is developing a scalable UAM ecosystem that includes infrastructure and operations, aiming to provide passengers with fast, safe, and emission-free flights directly to their destinations. The flagship product, the VoloCity, is currently in the final stages of flight testing, with plans to achieve certification from the European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) and commence commercial operations in the near future. With over 500 employees and more than 2,000 successful test flights, Volocopter has attracted significant investment from notable partners such as the Mercedes-Benz Group, Geely, Intel Capital, and BlackRock. The company's mission is to revolutionize urban mobility, and its vision is to lead the UAM industry by offering efficient and reliable air transport solutions.

Name: ASTRA E.V.
Company description: About our current project - "ùôãùôßùô§ùôüùôöùôòùô© ùôÜùôñùôßùô¢ùôñùô£",       To date, there are no student groups within Europe that have successfully designed, built, and launched a rocket that has reached space (100 km altitude).  Reaching the Karman line (the boundary of space) is generally regarded as the first step to developing launch system technologies and serves as a good platform from which to understand the technical challenges involved in building orbital launchers, which is a field that is currently expanding exponentially.        The ongoing mission of ùóîùó¶ùóßùó•ùóî (Association for Space Technology and Research Applications) is to provide an opportunity for students of the University of Bremen to engineer and innovate in a capacity that complements their programs.  The Karman Project is the first project to be accepted by ùóîùó¶ùóßùó•ùóî and it is ASTRA‚Äôs hope that future innovative projects will follow to continue broadening the education available at the University of Bremen. The primary goal of the project is to design, build, and launch a rocket to reach an altitude of 100 km. This project shall serve as a technology demonstrator and engineering exercise to enhance the quality of education at the University of Bremen through the availability of hands-on experience for the student body and inspire the student community.  If successful, this vehicle could serve as a platform to launch future scientific payloads requiring 5-10 minutes of microgravity.

Name: VEOWARE SPACE
Company description: Behind each industrial revolution there is a disruptive technology or process. Our team exists to make the most complex systems easier to use and available to all types of customers. Our scalable standard products address our customer‚Äôs needs rapidly and they no longer need to wait for custom-made solutions. The technology that we are developing for our longer term ambitions has raised more interest than we ever thought. Our first product is a Micro CMG. Large satellites have used this actuator technology for decades. We miniaturized it for small satellites applications and made it modular & scalable. A control moment gyroscope (CMG) is an attitude control unit (actuator) consisting of a spinning rotor (also referred as a fly wheel) and one or more motorized gimbals that tilt the rotor‚Äôs angular momentum. As the rotor tilts, the changing angular momentum causes a gyroscopic torque that rotates the spacecraft. With this technology, we can easily increase the agility of your satellites. Interested? Send us an email at sales@veoware.space !

Name: Air Lituanica
Company description: Air Lituanica is a new Lithuanian airline. The company plans to begin convenient direct flights from Vilnius, the capital of Lithuania, and to improve air travel links with Lithuania. In preparation for the start of flights, Air Lituanica is presenting to the public its company brand, which is inspired by Lithuanian history and aviation tradition. The new company‚Äôs name commemorates the non-stop flight of Lithuanian pioneer pilots Steponas Darius and Stasys Girƒónas across the Atlantic Ocean in a small aircraft named Lituanica in 1933. The company‚Äôs logo features an old-style Lithuanian cross with two transepts, a symbol which was often used in Lithuanian aviation in the inter-war period. In the Air Lituanica logo this cross is modernised and it becomes stylised aircraft propeller blades. Air Lituanica company symbols also make use of the ducal seal of Vytautas Magnus, Grand Duke of Lithuania, to symbolise the Lithuanian origin of the airline. The company symbol is presented on a rich red background. Historically, red was the most important colour for symbols of nationhood of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, representing energy and vitality. Air Lituanica, our new airline, will base its services on the fundamental values of flight safety, reliability and convenience.

Company description: I.C.P. was born in 1980, the main activity was concentrated on wiring production for domestic appliance and electromechanical sector.  In the following years, starting from 1984, the company specialized in the design and production of wear indicators of friction materials for disc and drum brakes of cars, industrial vehicles and motorcycles, as well as wiring in the same sectors . Starting from 1988 was joined to this activity the import of microlight aircraft ‚ÄúChickinox‚Äù, and the following year I.C.P. began with planning, design and production of ultra-light aircraft aluminium alloy, with exclusive features of sturdiness and versatility, well known for the security guarantees at international level.  At the end of the 90s, the Sole Director Tancredi Razzano, decided to industrialize the production of ultralight aircraft, up to that time built solely in the artisan sector with the use of templates and stopovers. Starting to produce all the details of the aircraft in series, with the use of CNC machines, I.C.P. it faces a conspicuous economic investment which, although costly, turns out to be profitable in the long run. The results obtained have led to excellent cost optimization, the facilitation of aircraft assembly and the achievement of a final product of superior quality to the handcrafted one. With this production strategy, a significant contribution has been made to making flying economically accessible to all enthusiasts, while at the same time recording significant company growth.

Name: Kreios Space
Company description: Kreios develops Very Low Earth Orbit (VLEO) satellites enabled by their proprietary  Air-Breathing Electric Propulsion (ABEP) system, that makes it possible for satellites to operate at an altitude of around 200 kilometers from Earth, an altitude once considered impossible because of atmospheric drag.  By ‚Äúbreathing‚Äù the atmosphere as fuel, Kreios‚Äô satellites can stay aloft for years instead of days, unlocking a region of space with massive implications for Earth Observation and Telecommunications. Name: FuelPlus Group
Company description: OUR STORY The FuelPlus Group is the leading provider of fuel administration and management software to the aviation industry. Established in 2000 and headquartered in Germany the FuelPlus Group operates worldwide with a global development and support center in Europe and regional offices in America, Europe and Asia.  In line with the Group's mission to provide world leading fuel management solutions that empower the aviation industry to implement robust processes, increase efficiencies and control costs, FuelPlus has developed the FuelPlus Fuel Management platform. Currently in use at nearly 50 airlines and suppliers on 4 continents this platform has proven its value in day to day business, managing approx. 25% of the annual worldwide jet fuel consumption. As a full service provider FuelPlus supports the industry with product-related services including consulting, service desk, and training as well as with fuel business process outsourcing services. Close collaboration with industry-leading carriers and fuel suppliers as well as with industry organizations such as IATA ensures constant product and service enhancements. DEVELOPED BY THE INDUSTRY, FOR THE INDUSTRY FuelPlus works close with industry-leading airlines and aviation fuel suppliers to develop state of the art fuel management products and services. FuelPlus fuel management solutions continue to be shaped by the customers' needs, thanks to an annual user group, industry associations, and the open, responsive approach to business. As an IATA Strategic Partner, FuelPlus is working with the industry on the development of new data standards. This will allow seamless data integration between all parties involved in the aviation fuel business.

Name: MUSKthrust GmbH
Company description: Take to the sky. Strive for greatness. To Revolutionize Urban Mobility The history of urban mobility is strongly intertwined with the development of housing. For centuries we have succeeded in being able to support a growing number of passengers via an increasing number of transportation solutions, thus enabling us to increase the density of our cities, ultimately setting the foundation for our modern society. We strongly believe that we, to achieve the next step in this evolution, need to move into the third dimension. To achieve this goal we set out not just to create something capable of flight, but rather to create a product that is capable of bringing a premium experience to the consumer market. To Revolutionize Personal Aerial Vehicles (PAV) It is our conviction that we can bring the freedom of personal air travel to the mass market. This goal was taken with the development of the first mass-produced car and has been pursued to this day in many ideas with varying degrees of success. However, none of these ideas have yet managed to achieve actual access to the mass market. For this reason, we are pursuing the goal of achieving not only further developments in our product but in every single step that comes before and after it. To Revolutionize Industry The history of production is marked by several rapid upheavals that have fundamentally changed its face. Each of these upheavals has enabled humanity as a whole to advance into a new era of prosperity and freedom. It is now time for it to undergo fundamental change again. Our goal is to take 3D printing out of rapid prototyping and into mass production. This, in combination with a high degree of automation in production, enables us to achieve good cost efficiency in low production volumes. Also, our production can dynamically switch to new products and processes and incorporate modifications into existing products. For more of our story, visit www.muskthrust.com

Name: Cosmic Research
Company description: Cosmic Research is a rocketry student-run non-profit society from Universitat Polit√®cnica de Catalunya (UPC) based in Terrassa, Spain, developing low-cost suborbital rockets for peaceful applications.  On March 2017, we launched Resnik, the highest-flying rocket ever launched by students in Spain to date.  We have extensive experience in developing and testing solid rocket motors, namely Nebula-I & Nebula-III. Now we are about to make history with Bondar, the most ambitious rocket ever developed by students in Spain. Bondar is a supersonic single-stage stratospheric sounding rocket, propelled by a commercial solid motor and passively stabilized by fins, 2.8-m long and 35-kg heavy, set to reach a record-breaking altitude of 9 km. It will be launched from El Arenosillo, Spain, in May 2021. Since its foundation, we have launched over 30 rockets and 100 mini-satellites. We also provide launch service for CanSat competitions in Spain.  We are open for sponsorships.

Name: Airtec GmbH & Co. KG Safety Systems
Company description: The creation of the CYbernetic Parachute RElease System (CYPRES) was developed out of a desperate need to stop seeing people get killed while skydiving. Prior to the development of the CYPRES, automatic activation devices were unreliable and often fired at the wrong times. Inventor, Helmut Cloth felt called to create a solution after his friend Freddy Leising was killed during a bigway. The AAD‚Äôs of the time were more hazardous than helpful and so began a four-year commitment to creating a device that was literally perfect. Few thought it was possible, but it didn‚Äôt deter Cloth from seeing it through.  In 2019, CYPRES celebrates its 28th year of operation. Since the first CYPRES unit was sold, 224,000+ units have been produced, 5,000+ skydivers have been saved from death. More than 146,000,000+ jumps have been made using a CYPRES and a device has never failed to activate and cut the loop when the conditions were met.*   *As of our knowledge, and given the loop was routed through the cutter.  The CYPRES has been the automatic activation device of choice for millions of skydivers, the most elite special forces and the Red Bull Stratos Project.

Name: OSCAR
Company description: We are an interdisciplinary team of students and researchers from UHasselt and imo-imomec. Our disciplines vary from engineering to computer sciences, from physics to biomedical sciences, and from bachelors to PhDs. We are developing the next generation of quantum magnetic field sensors based on NV centers in diamond for space applications. While advancing technology motivates us to push forward, our main focus is on personal growth and inspiring the next generations of scientists and engineers to join challenging fields of space and quantum research. This project series started in 2015 with a REXUS/BEXUS stratospheric balloon experiment - OSCAR-BEXUS - a first step taking NV based magnetometers out of the lab, for a viability study, followed by OSCAR-QLITE in 2017/2018. In 2020 OSCAR-QUBE was selected for the ESA Academy ‚ÄúOrbit Your Thesis!‚Äù program. That allowed us to test our sensor aboard the International Space Station (ISS) for a length of ten months.  Currently, we are developing the next iteration of our sensor OSCAR-QUBE+ to be tested during Ariane 6 maiden flight as a scientific payload for the ESA YPSat mission. On top of that, our OSCAR-PINQ project got selected for the ESA Academy Experiments - Space Rider programme. We gained a lot of experience from all these projects, while optimizing the NV-based quantum sensing technology. That is why we are working hard to further optimize our magnetometers and we are looking for next challenges to test our devices in the space environment.

Name: Stellar Project
Company description: Stellar Project is a space technology company created in 2016 as a spin-off of the University of Padova, Italy, offering game-changing solutions for light satellites with a high degree of care towards space environmental sustainability.  Stellar Project aims to fill the gap in performances and capabilities between small satellites and large spacecraft, providing original and proprietary technology. The company vision embraces global space democratization, bringing together the best talent and creativity to develop bright ideas to fit into smart satellites products and services. In 2021, Stellar Project launched LaserCube, a proprietary and patented revolutionary technology. LaserCube is a patented miniature low-power, high-performance laser communication terminal specifically designed for CubeSats and smallsats. With its independent and accurate pointing capability, LaserCube allows throughput performance more than ten times higher than state-of-the-art radiofrequency solutions for small satellites enabling several innovative business applications.  LaserCube, as the optical telecommunication highway for small satellites, will deliver an unprecedented increase in data volume, communication security, and speed: another step towards accessible and affordable space technology for all. Stellar Project is also working in consortiums within the H2020 program on Quantum Communication and started to expand its activities on data analytics both for terrestrial applications and the space environment providing tools for Space Debris Analysis and monitoring. Stellar Project is a member of AIPAS ‚Äì Italian Space Industry Association and Access Space Alliance.

Name: MIST
Company description: Many universities in the world have built small satellites called CubeSats. The KTH Space Center started  its own CubeSat project, MIST, on January 28, 2015. The Miniature Student Satellite project, MIST, is a 3U CubeSat project carried out by the KTH Royal Institute of Technology in which students perform system level design, integration, test and operations. The nadir-pointing satellite carries five experiment from KTH and industry some of which aim at demonstrating new space science instruments (X-ray detectors) or electronics technologies (single event upset detection and SiC circuits). MSc students work for academic credits for up to two semesters or work on their theses in the project. The team leader is a senior manager from the space industry. The sponsoring professor is former ESA astronaut Christer Fuglesang, now professor of spaceflight technology at KTH. The project started in 2015 and is approaching the final phases of system level functional and environmental testing. All purchased satellite and ground station subsystems have been delivered. The technical/scientific experiments are being completed. The ground station is under construction. Final testing of the satellite is expected to be completed in 2022.

Name: Iwiation
Company description: iwiation GmbH provides expert assessments in the area of accident reconstruction and visualisation.  Witness and video footage can be essential, if flight data is not available or radar data is not complete / insufficient accuracy due to terrain reflection.  The world-wide unique method called Immersive-Witness-Interview (iwi¬Æ) was developed to reconstruct missing data based on eyewitness statements and / or video information for flight path reconstruction. Flight path and aircraft attitude data can be reconstructed based on available witness / video information. The reconstructed accident scenario can become quickly complex and visualization can be essential to provide material for documentation, analysis and explanation, how the accident occurred. Further, more and more accidents are related to human factors. Therefore a photorealistic real-time visualization can support to better understand the reconstructed accident scenario from different perspectives. Root causes like weather conditions, mission, reaction time, diversion, etc. can be analyzed with the developed Virtual-Reality environment. To do so, the reconstructed flight path and the overall accident scenario including terrain, aircraft geometry and cockpit instrumentation are transferred into Virtual-Reality, providing a real-time and photorealistic rendering. This can be used by authorities during the analysis of the accident sequence and dedicated scenes can be documented in the final report. The integrated eyetracking technology allows detailed human factor analysis of accident sequence playback. The results can be used by operators for lessons learned training to further improve aviation safety.

These upgrades enable you to view real-time airspace activations on the map, connect with your preferred traffic receiver, and much more, all designed to further enhance your flying experience. We are proud to collaborate with partners like SafeSky, Dynon Avionics, Advanced Flight Systems, MGL, LXNAV, and Naviter. Our commitment to flight safety has earned us the prestigious EASA GA Safety Award. Name: OFIL Airborne
Company description: We are specialized in the development and production of gyrostabilized, multispectral sensor systems for the airborne inspection of power lines/gasleak and oilspill detection + firefighting.  The product line includes 3 stabilized gimbal platforms with up to 5 high-end sensors for UV, IR, EO-Video and High-Resolution Still Images, OGI gas detection sensors and 3D Lidar as an option.  Our fiber optic system design is insensitive to radiometric interference and capable of transmitting virtually unlimited amounts of data to the flight recorder without compression. Precise radiometric + UV measurements, geo-tagging of all data, and deep integration of all sensors for an easy-to-use system are some of our main advantages that ensure the highest inspection efficiency in the market.  A software suite is included to speed up the process of post production doing advanced analysis of raw data and the production of reports.  Recent AI enhanced system developments assist the operator doing long distance flights with automated thermal- and UV inspection modes. Visual inspection missions can be done following the lines with pre-loaded data in automation. High-resolution images and videos are captured and stored according to selected patterns of interest. Partnerships with leading software integrators enable all recorded data to be consolidated in digital twins and databases to be built for asset management.

Name: Puli Space Technologies
Company description: ** A full service lunar water ice prospecting company - Exploring rough terrains & harsh environments ** Puli Space Technologies Ltd. is a space technology company based in Budapest, Hungary. Founded in 2010 with the aim to become part of the fast-growing private lunar economy, Puli Space develops a range of lunar exploration technologies. These include the NASA award-winning Puli Lunar Water Snooper (PLWS), a rugged, micro-sized, lightweight neutron spectrometer for exploring lunar water resources in support of In-Situ Resource Utilisation (ISRU) and, building on Puli's Google Lunar XPRIZE heritage, a low cost, lightweight planetary rover platform with unique high mobility capabilities. Puli also keeps an eye on Down to Earth applications. Puli‚Äôs first lunar payload, the Puli SpaceTime Plaque, was flown on the Peregrine Mission 1 of Astrobotic early 2024. On the IM-2 Mission of Intuitive Machines to the Lunar South Pole region in March 2025 the Puli Lunar Water Snooper became the first ever Hungarian instrument to land and operate on the Moon.

Company description: Mars Planet: working to the human exploration of Mars Mars Planet is an international cultural organization with headquarters in Italy which promotes the research and industrial applications connected to the human exploration of Mars and space. Mars Planet actively engages with small, medium and big enterprises in research related to Mars exploration, in order to support the creation of a new economy based on human space colonization.  A number of organizations and companies all over the world are contributing to this new economy, which will help solving some of the most important economic and technological challenges of today. Mars Planet cooperates with other organizations and companies working in the space sector and beyond. In our team there are space scientists, researchers and everyone who is interested in contributing to our projects. Information on our team is available here. The main project of Mars Planet is the construction of a research center called Mars City. This research center will include a Mars Simulation Area, a space dedicated to the development of technologies for robotics, virtual and augmented reality, software engineering, telecommunication, materials, energy and life support systems, as well as to scientific research and education. The technologies developed at Mars City will support space and Mars human exploration and will offer state-of-the-art solutions to many industrial and non-industrial sectors on Earth. If you would like to support our activities, feel free to contact us at info@marsplanet.org.

Name: Gate One - Coordination Platform
Company description: Gate One is a bottom up regional ANSP initiative established in 2013. The purpose of the coordination platform, is to promote the efficiency of European Air Traffic Management through enhanced cooperation among the participating service providers, as well as to ensure a more powerful and coordinated advocacy of the region in the European decision-making processes. Gate One covers 3 existing Functional Airspace Blocks ‚Äì FABs (Baltic FAB, Danube FAB and FAB CE) and 2 non-EU Flight Information regions (Belgrade and Skopje) The members of the Gate One initiative, which is one of the largest regional ANSP platforms in Europe, agreed to play a more active role to explore potential for future inter-FAB cooperation.   The Gate One Agreement was signed in Sofia by the CEO's of the ANSPs of Austria, Bulgaria, the Czech Republic, Croatia, Poland, Lithuania, Hungary, Romania, Slovakia and Slovenia. The Parties agreed on the accession of Bosnia-Herzegovina ANSP at their next meeting in January 2014. In 2015, ANSPs of Macedonia and Serbia joined the cooperation platform as the 12th and 13th member. The airspace between the Baltic Sea and the Black Sea is one of the most important gateways of the European continent: this region handles air traffic in the directions of North and South, East and West, sustaining links between the central and Nordic countries of the European Union as well as with the continent of Asia and the region of the Middle East.

Name: Harvis Project
Company description: Flight movements are growing significantly in Europe. As technological progress is allowing pilots to have more and more information on the flight conditions, it is also increasing their workload. In order to prevent peak workload conditions, automation will increase for all pilots‚Äô tasks: therefore, there is a need to frame the human-machine interaction in terms of partnership, building capacity in machines to better understand humans, and in people to engage collaboratively with them. In this context, the overall objective of HARVIS project is to identify how cognitive computing algorithms, implemented in a digital assistant, could support the decision making of a single pilot in complex situation. The project will produce a roadmap to help the EU and Clean Sky 2 Joint Undertaking orient the research and development in the next decade.

Name: Aviation Compliance & Safety
Company description: We are delighted to announce the launch of a brand new project. We are partnering with REDiFly to develop an efficient and user-friendly SMS Solution. We have also set up a private group where we will have live discussions, host workshops and share our value streams. Name: VINI Flyvbird
Company description: While fast and competitive prices exist between metropolitan areas, there are insufficient offers on decentralized rural connections available. Travel at conveniant and fast connections are not available. There is a growing need for alternative transportation, especially innovative, disruptive, and connected mobility. Our future customers live within a radius of 25 km from a departure point exclusive accessible for the flyv offer. Faster connections, less complex travel journeys, arrivals closer to the destination and vast time savings - that is our promise. Materializing a high network of underutilized airfields enables us to conquer an unoccupied market without competition. At the same time, our flyvAI is tailored to the customer's needs and leads to maximum efficiency. Our unique advantage in the market is due our use of advanced mathematical modeling within our software algorithm. This model enables us to efficiently pool decentral traffic streams and optimize on-demand commercial offers, ultimately allowing us to offer the fastest decentral connections at competitive prices with trains and cars. The mathematical model provides a solid foundation for scalability and efficiency, allowing us to offer the most dense regional air links in the world and capture a significant portion of the market. Overall, flyv's focus on sustainable travel, efficient operations, and advanced technology make us a compelling investment opportunity in the aviation industry. We believe it has the potential to revolutionize regional air travel and disrupt the traditional airline industry. Our technology is unique and one of a kind in the market

Name: ESA BIC Poland
Company description: ESA Business Incubation Centres (ESA BICs) are the largest network of space incubators in Europe. The main objective of ESA BICs is to support entrepreneurs with a space-based business idea, thereby creating and growing clusters of space related start-ups across Europe.   All ESA BIC are managed by local champions who connect their ESA BICs to their local industry, universities, research organisations, government, and investor communities, while also maintaining strong regional/national links. This makes the ESA BICs very well embedded in the local communities as well as the place of choice for all space related innovation and business.  ESA BIC Poland is joining the network as the 26th ESA BIC. The objective of ESA BIC Poland is to create and strengthen the community of successful space related start-ups in Poland by supporting 35 incubatees over the period of 5 years under the ESA BIC scheme. ESA BIC Poland's tasks include: ‚Ä¢	promoting entrepreneurship; ‚Ä¢	supporting cooperation between science, business and administration; ‚Ä¢	activities that strengthen international cooperation; and support for the SME sector. Beneficiaries of the program, are micro, small or medium-sized enterprises, operating in the market for no more than 5 years, providing products, processes or services using new technologies or with innovative use of existing technologies. ESA BIC Poland's activities are conducted and coordinated by the Industrial Development Agency JSC in cooperation with the Incubation Centers in Warsaw and Rzeszow.

Name: PW-Sat
Company description: Our group is part of the Students‚Äô Space Association at the Warsaw University of Technology. Starting from  2004,  we have been creating international teams committed to designing and developing satellites.  In 2018, soon after the launch of PW-Sat2, our team started planning the next mission. Currently, over 20 students specializing in various engineering fields are working to get PW-Sat3 ready for launching in 2023.  The  mission  plan  aims  to  test  the  following  subsystems developed  by Association members: 1. Cold-gas propulsion‚ÄìThe growing number of satellite constellations causes high demand for propulsion systems on the CubeSat market. Following this trend, our student team designed a butane propulsion system with an additional heating chamber and membrane for phase separation. According to the mission plan, the device will perform orbit correction and deorbit manoeuvres to address the collision risk and space debris problems.  2. Attitude Determination and Control System (ADCS) ‚ÄìEssential to performing manoeuvres with the cold-gas propulsion. We are developing our own pointing algorithms including SIL/HIL simulation solutions based on COTS components. We are also considering testing Earth Horizon Sensors based on low-res IR matrices as the secondary ADCS experiment.  3. Ham radio experiments-similarly to the PW-Sat2 team, we also want to leave a positive mark on the Ham radio society. Besides making the telemetry public, the team is working on implementing a transponder and various easter eggs to make interacting with the satellite interesting and fun.

Name: SkyRadar
Company description: SkyRadar is the first commercially available educational radar & SMC training system for ATSEP and military users. Operating within the milliwatt range, the SkyRadar radar training system is completely safe for indoor and outdoor experiments. SkyRadar provides radar kits blended with training curricula and scenarios for high level skills development. The SkyRadar Training System was developed in partnership with leading companies from the Air Traffic Management industry, independent specialists and a globally experienced systems integrator. SkyRadar investigates the function and applications of modern primary and secondary radars through practical experiments. From civil air traffic control to military and EW applications, all topics are covered by an unsurpassed number of interesting experiments Conventional educations systems usually only allow "black box" examinations.  What takes place inside the devices remains a mystery to the student.  The SkyRadar Modules give students an opportunity to work with real radars and build up or modify in real-time the Digital Signal Processing Block Diagrams.

Name: Amonyx ApS
Company description: At Amonyx we take pride in creating contemporary wing technology capable of unique high lift and long range for any fixed winged or rotary aircraft, while at the same time achieving CO2 and fuel cost savings. We operate within three lines of operation: The ALS (Amonyx Augmented Lift System) providing 400% increased lift on fixed wings aircraft and 50% reduced drag over the wings during transit. This enables aircraft to either take of at 50% reduced Take Off speed @ 25% runway length or at least double the MTOW at similar take of speed. The technology can be fitted any size fixed wing aircraft from large cargo aircraft over a commercial commuter size aircraft to a small single engine aircraft.  The ART (Amonyx Rotor Technology) providing 300% increased lift and 50% reduced noise emission and thereby enhanced endurance capabilities. This also provides enhanced capabilities in thin atmosphere operations. Furthermore, a dramatic reduction of noise emissions from the rotor blades enables tolerable operations perfectly fitting the future Urban Air Mobility applications. The AM-X fixed wing UAV series providing unprecedented capabilities within payload and range, and even combining the ALS and ART in to one system. THE AM-X UAV can be tailored to fit ISR task in the security domain (MALE ‚Äì 250kg payload ‚Äì 48hrs endurance) as well as being the enabler of unmanned high payload air transport for the cargo sector having the ability to take off and land at very short air strips <50m long carrying +1000kg. For further details, please feel free to reach out to amonyx@amonyx.com or visit our webpage. In any case, press ‚ÄúFollow‚Äù to get the latest news and developments right here on LinkedIn. AMONYX ‚Äì going anywhere

Company description: SAB Launch Services S.r.l. SAB-LS offers ‚Äúend to end‚Äù services including launch procurement, all integration activities of the satellite on the launch vehicle structure, pre and post launch support and full insurance at very competitive prices.  The company operates from its headquarters of Benevento (Italy), while payload integration activities in Europe are carried out in the SAB facility in Brno (The Czech Republic). Final Integration and Pre-Flight Operations are performed in the European Space Port in French Guiana.  VEGA is the satellite launch vehicle designed and produced by AVIO S.p.A and operated by ARIANESPACE. VEGA is optimized for LEO launches and can carry multiple payloads at a time to different orbits. With its perfect record of launch successes VEGA has demonstrated great flexibility at an affordable cost. VEGA-C is an upgrade of the current Vega launcher and will be operational early 2020. Vega C will bring the current Vega performance of about 1500 kg in SSO @700km to about 2200 kg.

Name: Mahepa
Company description: MAHEPA project is developing and flying two new hybrid-electric powertrains to enable cleaner, quieter and more efficient aircraft propulsion. By adopting a modular approach to propulsion system components design, for the first time two variants of a serial hybrid-electric powertrains will be tested in flight. The first uses a fuel-driven generator to charge the batteries and power the electric motor, while the second relies on fuel cells to produce power enabling zero-emission flight. Data from flight tests will be used to model future operating scenarios of hybrid electric aviation paving the way towards greener aircraft. The project is developing key technology and roadmap for market implementation of future hybrid-electric airplanes. After having completed successful ground demonstrations of a hybrid powertrain in previous project HYPSTAIR (FP7 605305), MAHEPA will deliver new, optimized propulsion components with increased reliability suitable for in-flight testing and future commercial deployment to small aircraft. The first flights of two four-seat airplanes equipped with MAHEPA hybrid electric powertrains are scheduled for 2020.

Una de nuestras principales virtudes es que todas nuestras m√°quinas son port√°tiles, siendo capaces de atender a nuestros clientes en sus propias instalaciones, con lo que se evitan costes de traslado de moldes/utillajes y se reducen los tiempos de m√°quina parada.  La soldadura l√°ser, aporta la distinci√≥n de que no se producen distorsiones t√©rmicas ni mec√°nicas en los materiales procesados, no se var√≠a la dureza, se puede soldar cualquier tipo de metal (Cu, Cu-Be, Aluminio, Titanio, Acero, Plata, etc‚Ä¶) adem√°s de que al tratarse de una soldadura m√°s precisa se reducen las tareas posteriores de ajuste. Todo ello hace de la soldadura l√°ser el m√©todo id√≥neo para reparaciones y/o modificaciones de molde y utillajes y eliminaci√≥n de grabados. Todo ello partiendo del asesoramiento t√©cnico y la profesionalidad de t√©cnicos cualificados y con amplia experiencia en el sector. El grabado-marcado l√°ser  nos permite insertar cualquier referencia, logotipo, fechador, etc‚Ä¶ en los moldes o el utillaje de una determinada empresa, a partir de un dise√±o entregado por el propio cliente o a partir de dise√±os creados por nosotros mismos.  En cuanto a la limpieza l√°ser, se trata de un proceso en el que se vaporiza la suciedad, no existiendo contacto f√≠sico con el material a limpiar, y con el que se evita el uso de productos qu√≠micos, la generaci√≥n de residuos, y el empleo de medios mec√°nicos de limpieza que implican la aparici√≥n de marcas y con el tiempo variaciones dimensionales.   Toda nuestra experiencia y buen hacer, nos ha llevado a que importantes empresas espa√±olas hayan confiado en nosotros y nuestras maquinas l√°ser para desarrollar trabajos en empresas del mismo grupo en el extranjero.

Name: Lunar Resources Registry
