Company description: Lunar Resources Registry (LRR) is an early-stage Lunar Mining Exploration company.  Their initial focus was identifying high value resources locations on the Moon using remote sensing data, that may be used for In-situ Resources Utilization (ISRU), in the CisLunar economy, or back on Earth. These locations have been researched and added into their Lunar Resources Registry. Their current activities include developing with technology partners the hardware required to verify the presence of resources, and extract resources, from the Moon. Lunar Resources Registry UG is an Alumni of the European Space Agency Business Incubation Centre (ESA BIC) in Hessen, managed by CESAH in Darmstadt.  Recently, Thales Alenia Space‚Äôs Space Business Catalyst and Lunar Resources Registry UG have signed a 'Memorandum of Understanding' (MOU) to enable and accelerate the exploration of lunar and space resources; this joint 'European Space Resources Project' is to develop cost-efficient lunar resources exploration solutions, from sampling regolith, to potentially deploying light Lunar landers. LRR also maintains a registry of activity on the Moon and is a provider of Lunar Maps (printed and online). It is also a functional platform for transparent Lunar Governance, as it displays Public (non-commercial) and Commercial (private) activity, including the latest missions and their status. LRR has developed a Registry Platform, parallel to Legal and Policy Frameworks, to give the CisLunar and Space Resources industry a platform to plan and co-ordinate future surface operations.

Company description: The SIAM Cluster Association (Spanish Innovative Air Mobility) was created to become an international benchmark for innovation and high technology in the air mobility sector in Spain. It integrates commercial companies, research units, associations, and other entities with a national and international vocation in this sector. They freely associate to boost the interaction of the different agents, with the aim of dynamizing and fostering relationships between them, involving them in collaborative exchange processes aimed at obtaining advantages or benefits derived from the execution of innovative joint projects, which allow improving the competitiveness of its members and their international projection and visibility. The Cluster will aim to manage, promote, defend, coordinate, and represent the common interests of its members, as well as increase their competitiveness in sectors related to the field of air mobility, which allows them to face any challenges and opportunities that derive from it, as well as promote the development of the necessary infrastructure. All this by promoting research, development, and innovation in the products and services of its members. SIAM is a non-profit association, and its objective is to facilitate the entry of innovation into the market, through collaboration in the creation of new disruptive business models. In this way, it becomes the meeting point of the country‚Äôs companies, facilitating their communication and positioning Spain‚Äôs know-how on new market niches, with the same aim of being a reference at an international level. Our main focus has always been the human being:  - How well is the individual prepared?  - How can team efficiency be improved?  - How can teams be trained, accompanied or even taken care of in a crisis?  - How well is a company prepared to handle a crisis?  - What kind of preparation and structures are needed to ensure that the special tasks demanded in a crisis are completed successfully? Name: BOOSTER Space Industries
Company description: BOOSTER is the implementation of a strategic plan for enabling a broader commercial space market base.  It is a contribution to the NewSpace industrial effort, and it is a diverse array (network) of all the technical, political, strategic, legal (regulatory) and financial expertise required to push commercial space forward. It has a very unique inter/multi-national perspective with its roots in Europe, but with an active American, Eastern, and Asian engagement. We started life as a study = a capability reality check, that evolved into a technical solution for sub-orbital spaceflight that then acquired a consortium of companies, agencies, and individuals: who all made valuable contributions to critique and shore-up this multi-faceted endeavour. We have realised after many years of investment that our niche area of expertise encompasses the Edge of Space. This is anything from 10km to 150km altitude, from 10 m/s to Mach 5, from robotic to piloted flight, from philantropic to business practical.  Our strengths are technical and regulatory. This is where we excel. But we are pragmatic and self-aware to realise that business excellence is much more multidisciplinary. Our world requires applied expertise across a range of disciplines to execute to solve a problem. No single person or small group is able to be good at everything. We therefore have assembled a functioning, diverse, and resourceful team built of all the niche things needed for Edge of Space. We have an entrepreneurial mind-set and a business approach that has been honed through interactions with some very good entrepreneurial business schools and people. This has given a good understanding of the emerging NewSpace markets and their caveats. Core Specialities: Space-aeroplane Type Design and ICAO Annex 8 compatible certification and operations. Reach out if you want some help in accessing this window of opportunity. We guarantee a great introductory conversation.

Name: Jargon Aviation Consultancy
Company description: Since 2000 Jargon Aviation Consultancy supports civil and military organisations in the interpretation and implementation of aviation regulatory requirements. The focus is on the  European requirements dealing with initial and continuing airworthiness: EASA Part-21, Part-M, Part-145, Part-66, Part-147 and their military equivalents. The international standards of ICAO and  IS-BAO and the Dutch national aviation regulations are also within Jargon's field of activity. Jargon provides the translation from the specialist language of the regulations to the reality of daily life in the aviation business. Activities are aimed at industry and governmental and non governmental organisations. The interaction between these activities makes Jargon an extra valuable partner for all parties.  Besides regulation itself, Jargon also provides services on regulation related subjects like quality assurance, auditing, safety management, human factors and incident investigation. Services offered include training, consulting and investigating. Jargon specialises in tailor-made solutions for its customers in Europe and the rest of the world. Name: CanSat In Greece
Company description: CanSat in Greece is a Greek space competition, which is held this year for a second time in a row and is organized by SPIN - Space Innovation. SPIN - Space Innovation is a non-profit organization based in Greece that focuses on research and development in the space sector and aims to form and develop a Greek space community utilizing education and projects such as CanSat in Greece.  The competition is voluntary initiative by undergraduate students of the National Technical University of Athens. The competition has two categories, one for undergraduate university students and one for high school students. The high school category is a qualifying phase of the European CanSats in Europe competition organized by the European Space Agency (ESA). The university category is held for the first time this year and is the first systematic effort to create a space competition for students in Greece. The aim of the competition is to familiarize participants with technologies similar to those used in a real satellite. Each team is made up of 4-6 people and is required to build an educational can sized satellite in order to perform a mission. This satellite launches at an altitude of one kilometer with the help of a rocket, then proceeds to land on a parachute and carry out the mission chosen by each team. Contact us at info@cansat.gr

Name: MAPRAD Srl
Company description: MAPRAD offers a full set of services relative to radiation hardness studies and for reliability qualifications.The knowledge and experience of MAPRAD‚Äôs team bases on many years of activity at CERN experiments and on space-based astroparticle physics experiments in particular for design, simulation, realization, test, qualification and commissioning of the complex electronics and radiation detection systems. MAPRAD is proudly active since 2005 and have collaborated (and collaborating) with major European space industry, research Institute and space agencies. A non-exhaustive list of partners and collaborations is given in this link. MAPRAD, with HIPRAD ( HIgh Precision RAdiation Detector), is winner of Italy of Innovators 2011/2012 promoted by Agency for innovation of Council of Presidency of Italy We have tested against radiation effects (Single Event Effects (SEE), Total Ionising Dose (TID), Displacement Damage (DD), charge-build-up, solar radiation effects with UV/VUV) more than 300 integrated circuit components constituted in different device technologies (CMOS, BiCMOS, SOI, Power MOS, BJT, JFET, analog/digital microelectronics, CCD, APS, MEMS) and many optical materials, solar cells, composites and polymers. We can simulate the radiation environment and its effects on electronics and electromechnical devices and systems. These simulations can be executed on single electronics parts, subsystem and also on entire system level. MAPRAD prepares the test setup necessary for radiation testing with all necessary ancillary circuitry, debug the entire system functioning prior to go to the irradiation site with its patented pulsed laser system, and executes the tests at irradiation site following major qualification standards (ECSS/ESA; JEDEC, MIL etc.). If necessary, propose and implement mitigation techniques or alternative solutions. The services of MAPRAD are offered thanks to a consortium constituted by local research infrastructures.

Name: ClimOP
Company description: The overall impact of aviation emissions on climate (CO2 and other emissions) has been estimated to be 5% of the total anthropogenic radiative forcing. Although in recent years the aviation sector has put significant efforts in stabilising its CO2 emissions at 2020 levels through a combination of technological innovations and regulation, a lot remains to be done to reduce the overall impact of aviation on climate.  ClimOp aims to investigate, in a sound research framework, which operational improvements may have a positive impact on climate, taking non-CO2 effects from NOx, water vapour and contrails, into account.  As a first step, ClimOP will identify a set of operational improvements that are potentially effective in reducing the impact of aviation on climate. A preliminary list of promising improvements includes, for example, electric taxiing, flexible runway usage and intelligent runways lights, flexible terminal-manoeuvring-area operations and intermediate stops. ClimOp will quantify the impact these measures have on climate.  Subsequently, the feasibility, effectiveness, and impact on aviation stakeholders of the proposed operational improvements will be validated with representatives of all actors in the aviation industry, such as airlines, airports, passengers and ANSPs. The validation will also account for economic factors and the constraints posed by safety and security requirements.  Finally, harmonised mitigation strategies will be provided, together with a series of recommendations for policymakers, to support measures to implement the proposed set of operational improvements.

Name: Jetpel GmbH
Company description: JETPEL ‚Äì we make you fly! We provide the power and thrust for your aircraft. And the fun of jet flight!  Jetpel GmbH was founded in 2019 in Aachen, Germany, as e.SAT Powertrain GmbH while developing the innovative powertrain for the Silent Air Taxi as part of e.SAT GmbH. We established our new brand JETPEL in October 2021 as we gained profound knowledge on forward-looking propulsion concepts in the last years that we now share with our customers.  We develop ultra-silent and environment-friendly powertrains for aircraft ranging from 1 occupant to 19 passengers as well as unmanned applications. Our mission is to provide a noiseless and emission-free powertrain as a sustainable solution to noise and emission related acceptance problems through technological innovation and thus becoming an enabler for the new air mobility for intermodal transport.  The core innovation of our propulsion system is an ultra-silent ducted propeller - the jetpeller - with a proprietary architecture and blade design that largely cuts noise generation and propagation, in combination with a modular, hybrid-electric powertrain platform. Therefore, we are investigating both multi-fuel piston engines with electric boost and also hydrogen fuel cell concepts for a green propulsion. This also includes energy storage aspects.  Besides supplying the complete powertrain and single components, we support as JETPEL our customers with powerplant integration from energy storage to cooling, engineering and simulations, access to a highly modern test infrastructure and provides consulting in certification.

Name: HOSTmi
Company description: After founding HOSTmi in July 2018, the European Space Agency's (ESA) Incubation Centre provided funding in August 2018 and global promotion and recognition was achieved. HOSTmi started to build and operate the first space mobility web platform matching between carrier assets and hosted payload requirements in order to introduce highly needed innovation in a field that is becoming increasingly important. In order to make this service available to a broad range of stakeholders, and to streamline the requirements-engineering within NewSpace, we have been working on digital mapping of all relevant space mission requirements, semantic standardization, semi-automated requirements-engineering processing, and the development of intelligent requirements matching algorithms. We consider this current platform called miSMART as an intermediate step towards our long-term goal with the company: offering a web-based (either closed or marketplace-oriented) Digital Twin as a Service (DTaaS) Platform. Our vision is to develop a digital environment in which space industry players can configure and operate digital twins of their assets (e.g. satellites). In doing so, we aim to overcome cross-organizational boundaries and increase the overall efficiency of a space mission. We are focusing on delivering an Industry 4.0 Digital Twin framework called the ‚ÄúAsset Administration Shell‚Äù, which enables organizations to share information and models across the lifecycle of a space mission. The entire solution will be web-based and can be used anytime, anywhere! These digital twins (DT) will come in place for different use cases along the entire value chain. One of these use cases is the operation of a spacecraft that could be handled via a so-called "Onboard Digital Twin" which is an AI-supported "edge-DT" on the spacecraft being instantiated from a so-called Master Model. The Master Model in combination with the Onboard Digital Twin is the orchestrator of the entire mission.

Name: ESA BIC Greece
Company description: The Greek Ministry of Digital Governance has identified the creation of the ESA BIC Greece as a key element in the development plan of the Greek Space Industry. The objective of the ESA BIC Greece is to strengthen the community of successful space-related start-ups in Greece by supporting 25 incubatees over the period of 5 years under the ESA BIC scheme so that they can develop their business and their technology until they are ready to leave the incubation phase and continue operating and growing without support from the incubator. ESA Business Incubation Centres‚Äô goal are to create jobs and develop regional economies via the ESA BICs programme in the ESA Member States. They provide incubation services to promising space related start-ups in order to help them become successful companies by exploiting space technologies or utilising space systems in non-space markets (spin-off), or by becoming suppliers to the space sector, e.g. by exploiting non-space technology in the space market (spin-in). This European-wide network, which annually fosters the creation of more than 140 start-ups across Europe, has led to the creation of more than 900 new enterprises since its inception in 2003 with a survival rate of 85%. Who is operating the ESA BIC Greece? Corallia, a unit of the Research Center Athena, is tasked with implementing the ESA BIC Greece. This will be accomplished in collaboration with more than 65 supporting organisations. Those supporters are Ministries and Public Agencies, Universities, Research Centers, Large companies and SMEs, Financing Institutions, Associations and Networks, other ESA BICs and Civil Society NFPs in Greece and ESA Members.

Name: VOIDSHIP
Company description: The rapidly expanding nano and microsatellite industry demands a launch service that is as agile, adaptable, and cost-effective as the spacecrafts themselves. We are here to address this need.  Therefore, VOIDSHIP‚Äôs first launch vehicle, VS-1, combines a reliable and innovative 3D printed engine that is connected to cryogenic pumps with a simple, cost effective rocket architecture to create the most customisable micro launch system on the market. The launcher will measure approximately 7 metres in height and 0,5 metres in diameter and will have a maximum payload to LEO of 25 kilograms per transport.  Starting in 2025, VOIDSHIP will launch the VS-1 launch vehicle, which will provide affordable, dedicated rides to orbit for nano and microsatellites. VOIDSHIP aspires to be the world's leading nano and microsatellite launch service, providing dedicated launches to the orbit and schedule of the customer's choice. By using a cryogenic fueled orbital launch vehicle, VOIDSHIP aims to offer the launch service that will  enhance the acceleration of the nano and microsatellite industry.  Thus, the technology combined with the workflow will offer the agility, flexibility and cost-effectiveness essential to redefine the space sector.

Name: BeCoM
Company description: Welcome to BeCoM's LinkedIn page! Better Contrail Mitigation, "BeCoM," stands at the forefront of cutting-edge research, generously funded by the EU. BeCoM's mission is to enhance our understanding of the climate impact linked to contrails. We'll share all the latest updates, innovations, and research findings from the BeCoM Project so follow us!  BeCoM will largely reduce (>50%) or eliminate the global mean contrail radiative forcing, hence a substantial reduction of aviation‚Äôs share of global warming to be achievable on a much shorter time horizon. This is facilitated by confidently forecast of persistent contrails, the reduced weather-dependent individual contrail radiative effects, and the successful avoidance of strongly warming contrails via trajectory optimization.

Name: Brain Matters
Company description: At Aviation Brain Matters, we specialize in providing professional teaching and learning training for aviation professionals. Visit us: www.aviationbrainmatters.com We offer customized training courses for both individuals and Approved Training Organizations (ATOs), fully aligned with industry standards and civil aviation authority requirements. Our team is composed of commercial pilots who also hold degrees or undergraduate level merits in psychology, cognitive science, or adult education. This unique combination of aviation expertise and academic qualifications allows us to equip participants with skills that are directly applicable to real-world aviation operations. Our courses stand out for their deep focus on how the brain learns and retains information, particularly under the high-stress conditions typical in aviation. By integrating insights from cognitive science and learning psychology, we ensure that our training methods not only enhance practical skills but also optimize cognitive performance, decision-making, and memory retention. Whether in the cockpit or the classroom, we maintain a strong emphasis on the practical application of aviation teaching principles, emphasizing how the human learning system operates in this environment. This ensures that the techniques and strategies we teach are are both theoretically sound and highly relevant to modern aviation challenges.

Name: SkyOptim
Company description: SkyOptim stands as a research and consulting company with a specialized focus on optimizing air traffic. Our proprietary software serves as a robust tool, enabling airline companies and air traffic controllers to elevate their operational efficiency through the implementation of tailored recommendations.  Distinguished by our innovative adaptation of deep learning methodologies, which prioritize pattern-based rule discovery over traditional neural networks, our system excels in swiftly and precisely identifying the operational strategies employed by air traffic controllers.  Once elucidating these patterns, we can achieve a win-win scenario, enhancing both air traffic control efficiency and delivering benefits to the airline companies. The benefits are also quantified in relation to gas emissions, allowing us to assess the environmental impact and estimate the overall environmental gain. Furthermore, our approach proves effective in estimating operational risks by connecting our understanding of air traffic control strategies with associated error scenarios.

Name: MagentaLock
Company description: The AGL safety screw comes as one piece, in a non-losable connection of pre-assembled safety washer. It can be used for shallow base installations. The system is comprised of a pair of washers that has cams on one side and radial teeth on the opposite side. Name: ASTER On REXUS 30
Company description: ASTER is a student project from Lule√• University of Technology for Cycle 13 of the REXUS/BEXUS programme. The aim of the project is to develop a fast, low-cost and easy to integrate attitude control system for free falling experiments from sounding rockets. The launch of the experiment is planned to be during March 2023 from Esrange Space Center in Kiruna, Sweden. The REXUS/BEXUS programme is performed under a bilateral agreement between DLR and SNSA/ESA. It allows students from universities and higher education colleges across Europe to carry out scientific and technological experiments on research rockets and balloons. Each year, two rockets and two balloons are launched. - http://rexusbexus.net https://www.facebook.com/aster.rexus/ http://instagram.com/aster.rexus

Name: Spacelink
Company description: Humans have been placing artificial satellites in Earth orbit for about 60 years with a purpose of earth observation, communication and navigation. There has been a lot of development effort in miniaturizing satellite technology, resulting in the increasing production of micro- and nanosatellites. These range from under 1kg to a few hundred kilograms in mass. Currently, transport to orbit is achieved with large rockets, which allows very little flexibility with the final orbit, launch frequency and schedule. In Spacelink we believe we can differentiate by developing  small-in-size and high-performance rockets based on hybrid rocket propulsion to change the way payload is launched into orbit.

OUR VALUE PROPOSITION FOR AIRLINES Acceler offers access to a scalable global network of travel consultants and SMEs to enable the execution of targeted strategic sales campaigns. Acceler allows airline to create and execute highly customisable targeted campaigns, and gives them the flexibility to respond to market conditions quickly and effectively. PRODUCTS & SERVICES - ACCELER: a cloud-based software, fully automated, which allows the user to run loyalty promotional campaigns to incentivize individual travel consultants to sell its passenger seats. Loyalty rewards are expressed as miles rewards and can be redeemed in various forms.  - COMPANY BONUS: A cloud based software, fully automated, which allows the user airline to run loyalty promotional campaigns to incentivize SMEs to buy its passengers seats instead of the ones of competing airlines. Loyalty rewards are expressed as miles rewards and can be redeemed in various forms. - SALES & IMPLEMENTATION SUPPORT: Acceler provides end to end support to its travel partners to set up the online portal, file data feed creation, testing and launch, marketing campaign planning, sales planning, sales campaigns, planning and executing targeted promotions, and more.  - REDEMPTION: Acceler offers several convenient mile redemption options: airline Frequent Flyer Programme miles, gifts from online catalogues, cash redemption on debit cards / virtual wallets, or manual redemption at airline points of sale.         HOW OUR PLATFORMS WORK - Individual TCs (or TAs or TMCs) and SMEs report their sales through a web portal, where they can monitor their rewards  Rewards can be redeemed as cash, gifts, airline FFP miles, or through third-party reward programmes - Travel companies operate from an Administrator Portal, which is used to manage the targeted promotional campaigns, monitor performance of their trade partners and SMEs, have access to a database of individual TCs and SMEs  WHY ACCELER - Acceler is a web-based loyalty programme which enables travel companies to incentivize TCs to sell their products instead of the ones of competitors, and to incentivise SMEs to buy more products from the same travel companies. - Provides individual TCs (or TAs or TMCs as a whole) the opportunity to be awarded with miles and other rewards for selling more products of their travel partners   - Provides SMEs the opportunity to be awarded with miles and other rewards for being loyal to their travel partners   - Creates a scalable global network of loyal TCs and SMEs for travel companies, enabling the execution of strategic sales campaigns - Allows travel companies to execute highly customisable targeted campaigns, giving them the flexibility to respond to market conditions quickly and effectively  - Through extensive automation, provides for a very compelling cost of sale.

Name: MvAERO CFD
Company description: Mass times velocity equals momentum. In the world of expensive CFD analysis, the mass of weighty decision-making has always been enormous, but the velocity of accurate results has been painfully slow. In a collaboration between experts in the next generation of fluid dynamics software and advanced aeronautical design, a radically more powerful and faster solution has emerged. mvAERO brings a hundred times more velocity to the process of discovering the real-world physics of complex, moving parts in viscous flows. Simultaneous internal and external geometries with heat transfer? No problem. NASA-level R&D on a homebuilder budget? Finally here. mvAERO creates highly visual, video-based simulations that communicate and validate at a level far beyond conventional analysis. With real-time and slow-motion video, optimization becomes collaborative, and the invisible is made obvious. The hidden value and refinements embedded in years of painstaking product development is communicated, often without a word.

Name: Polish Aviation Club/Polski Klub Lotniczy
Company description: Polish Aviation Club is a platform for discussion, exchange information or opinions and promotion a aviation issues. The aims of the Polish Aviation Club are: ‚áí Developing public awareness and interested institutions about the role of aviation for the economic, social and cultural development of the state. ‚áí Integration of the aviation environment. ‚áí Promote the development of aviation, training and aviation education. ‚áí Promote and deepen knowledge of aviation, aviation and aviation processes and programs within the European Union and in the world. ‚áí Support for legislative processes at the expert level.     The objectives of the Polish Aviation Club are realized through: 1. Cooperation with the broadly understood aviation community, public institutions, research institutes and universities in Poland and abroad. 2. Initiatives for the sustainable and harmonious development of the Polish aviation industry. 3. Presenting positions to public authorities in law making, strategies and plans for aviation development in Poland and in the EU. 4. Organize regular meetings with important people from the aviation industry, Polish and foreign guests. 5. Conducting scientific and technical information as well as studies and analyzes, publishing activities and activities in the organization of trainings, conferences and fairs. 6. Collaborate with other organizations of this type in Europe and in the world.     Polish Aviation Club is an open body for new members of natural persons but also institutions, organizations and companies related to the aviation industry. Remains also open to contacts and cooperation with the relevant aviation organizations in Europe and around the world. We propose the possibility to develop: opinions on innovation for investment needs, expertise, studies and analyzes, didactic and scientific aids, other publications.

Company description: ACS Advanced Centric Systems is a privately-held company providing high-end, technology-based system integration projects for air, land and naval defense, homeland security, and Safe/Smart City applications. Based on this approach, ACS has delivered various integrated defense and homeland security systems to clients worldwide. ACS is proud of its exclusive client roster, its partner network and the list of projects it has completed and delivered to date. ACS specializes in the following categories: INTEGRATED SOLUTIONS Homeland Security (HLS) ‚Äì Operational at some of the world‚Äôs most sensitive conflict areas, ACS radars and Electro-Optic payloads secure a wide range of protected sites, from borders and coastlines, national symbols and strategic infrastructures, to population centers. ACS‚Äôs comprehensive, integrated solutions utilize airborne, ground-based, maritime or mobile sensors, augmented by unattended platforms like aerostats and unmanned patrol vehicles, all integrated via highly secured information networks. ISR ‚Äì ACS delivers real-time intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance solutions for air, land, sea and space applications. ACS‚Äôs turnkey solutions cover the entire spectrum from tactical to strategic levels. These include Signal Intelligence (SIGINT), Image Intelligence (IMINT), Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) technologies, and day and night EO/IR systems, all implemented through integrated, networked and connected system of systems. AERIAL & AIRBORNE SYSTEMS AERIAL & AIRBORNE SYSTEMS ACS provides a wide range of solutions and services for aerial defense from special mission aircraft and advanced unmanned air systems (UAS) to precision guided munitions, multi-layered missile defense, and sophisticated C4ISR and navigation systems.

Name: Feuerherd Aviation Consulting GmbH
Company description: Feuerherd Aviation Consulting GmbH is a consulting company specialized in aviation strategy and management, based on the vast experience of its founder Sascha Feuerherd. The company aims at providing cutting edge solutions for airlines, airports and related stakeholders, by deploying its wide network of experts.  Sascha Feuerherd is an aviation industry professional with approximately 20 years of aviation experience, having gained exposure to a large variety of airlines by a dual career as active airline manager and industry consultant.  His airline management career was initiated with the renowned industry education program at German Lufthansa AG, one of the leading airlines in the world. This thorough education was followed by line management functions, later combined with experience from several dozen medium to large scale aviation consulting projects where he acted as Project Manager or Project Director.  As such, he had the opportunity to run projects at airline clients worldwide in strategic, operational and administrative areas while also taking over interim management roles. His efforts and team leadership enabled substantial cost savings, totaling several hundred Million Euros on an annual basis.  After leading the airline restructuring unit of Lufthansa Consulting, market leader in this specialized niche of aviation consulting, he then assumed management functions for all airline consulting projects run by the consulting division of the International Air Transport Association.  Feuerherd Aviation Consulting GmbH is an ultra-lean organization, relying on the industry experience of its managing director and vast network of specialized aviation consultants. We are not bound by corporate politics, a large administration or a costly overhead but only serve you as our client with the target of ensuring the most efficient operations.

Company description: Hawk Aviation Consultancy, is an aviation training & consultancy company, that specialises in professional independent validations for ACC3 , RA3 and KC3. To obtain the ACC3 status, an air carrier needs to submit its relevant air cargo or mail security operations in non-EU countries to an EU aviation security independent validation. This exercise, is carried out by an EU aviation security independent validator. The validator assess the carrier's security program to ensure its relevance and completeness.   In addition, our EU Aviation Security Independent Validators, will assess ACC3 implementation of aviation security measures during an on-site verification. The EU independent security validator will draft a report based on his findings and provide it the appropriate authority of the EU Member State that has been assigned for the designation of the ACC3. This validation needs to be reissued every five years according to the EU Regulation. If the ACC3 validated carrier wishes to have the security controls applied by a business partner such as known consignors, regulated agents or ground handlers at non-EU airports, these entities will also have to undergo independent validation, either as part of the carrier's accreditation or in their own right. Hawk Aviation Consultancy Independent Validators can assist you on this accreditation aswell.  Examples of aviation security training that we can provide:  *Aviation Security Training for security staff working on a security filter (passenger, crew and/or staff check) *Air Cargo Security training, all levels.  *Inflight supplies security training, all levels Examples of aviation security consultancy that we can provide: *ACC3/RA3/KC3 validations or pre-validations *EU Aviation/Air Cargo Security Consultancy/advisory *EU Aviation/Air Cargo Security Auditing Interested in one of our many services?. Please contact us for more information. We are the aviation security experts!  Info@hawk-consultancy.com

Name: Door2Door B.V.
Company description: Ticket prices are distorted to stay competitive. As a result, ticket prices become less transparent, and the consumer is misled into buying the ‚Äúcheapest‚Äù ticket. Additional costs, such as service costs, administration fees or fees for luggage and seat assignment are often not displayed when looking for a plane ticket. Even if all these costs were considered the consumer still has an incomplete view of their trip ahead. Low-Cost Carriers (LCCs) often fly from B-location airports to B-location airports, making the first and last mile of the trip more time consuming and more expensive. As of today, no good option to compare transportation from door-to-door exists. Our mission is to make travel easier with a door-to-door travel solution that calculates the optimal journey based on price, both for the flight and all other transportation to and from airports, and travel time. We do so by offering a platform where the traveler can leverage user profiles, group travel options, a real-time itinerary, offline travel guides, and a one-stop-shop to book all transportation and additional services in one place. We want to make life easier, take away the hassle and make people happy. Travelling should be fun and relaxing, people should not fight over their itinerary, argue whether the bus is faster, or why they have been walking for ten blocks and still have not found their destination. By taking away the hassle to figure out how to cover the first and last mile when flying continental, and provide our costumer with a door- to-door solution requiring only one purchase, we can make travel a lot more comfortable.

Name: Vintage Flights
Company description: Take a flight INTO HISTORY The Mustang is probably the most recognized fighter of World War II. Its speed and range made it the ideal bomber escort. Our Mustang was built in 1944. It served with the 434th Fighter Squadron, 479th Fighter Group as ‚ÄúSCAT VII‚Äù L2-W. It was the personal plane of Major Robin Olds, a triple ace who scored his 4 last kills in this particular machine. It is one of those rare P-51 Mustangs who survived WWII and is now still flying in the same color scheme it had over 70 years ago. Experience the Mustang P-51 yourself with our special Hero-package for ‚Ç¨2.200 all-in, contact us for a personalised offer.  Great news: We have recently established a partnership with the Antwerp-based Stampe & Vertongen museum to support them and keep its vintage aircraft in the air. One of these iconic aircraft is the ex-Belgian Air Force Fouga Magister CM.170 "MT-5". The twin-engine jet trainer joined the Belgian Air Force in 1960 and was once part of the famous display team 'Red Devils', of which it is now the only one retaining its original color scheme. After retirement from the Air Force, "MT-5" was shipped to Israel and later flew in the USA for a private owner. In 2014, "MT-5" arrived back at its new home base in Antwerp. The aircraft received major restoration and could finally return to the Belgian skies in 2017, where it belongs. In order to keep the Fouga in the air, you can sponsor the Fouga Project by donating ‚Ç¨2.000 or more to the S&V museum. In return for your generous gift, one of our Fouga pilots will give you a unique hands-on experience. For more information about becoming a sponsor, please contact us on https://vintage.flights/contact/.

Name: Aeroclub Volovelistico Del Mugello
Company description: The Aeroclub Volovelistico del Mugello was founded in 1990 by a small group of glider pilots willing to have a flying base near home in a potentially very interesting gliding area. It‚Äôs located on the ‚ÄúLa Collina‚Äù airfield, close to the village of Borgo San Lorenzo, north of the city of  Firenze. The 750x50m grass runway is served by a 600 sq.m. hangar which houses the club‚Äôs fleet and some privately owned gliders. Many more are located outside in their trailers during the best part of the gliding season, usually March to October. A small club house with toilets and showers completes the setup. There also is a certified aeronautical repair shop resident on the same field. The airfield is beautifully set in the quiet location of this northern corner of Tuscany, the Mugello valley, between the northern hills of Firenze and the Appennini mountains. Our gliding school has started in 1995, and an average of 7 new pilots per year take their licence following its courses. The current number of club members is about 70, and the club‚Äôs fleet is composed by four two-seaters and two towplanes. Additionally, about 20 private gliders are resident on the airfield. The field is an excellent starting point for cross-country flights along the spine of Italy, the Appennini range. Flights exceeding 500km are not uncommon at all, with the longest recorded well above 800 km. Several of our pilots are keen competitors, making the top rankings in national and international gliding competitions. Our Aeroclub is federated to the Italian National Aeroclub, the Italian Gliding Federation, and holds a national certification for the operation of both the fleet and the school.

Name: ASCenSIon
Company description: The purpose of the ASCenSIon project is to develop a programme that focuses on several specific areas of cutting edge space access research, particularly on launcher systems that are (partially) reusable and capable of injecting multiple payloads into multiple orbits. More than providing design concepts, the network aims to identify and advance critical technologies to prove a feasibility of these concepts.   The acronym ‚ÄúASCenSIon‚Äù stands for ‚ÄúAdvancing Space Access Capabilities ‚ÄìReusability and Multiple Satellite Injection‚Äù. It comprises our vision to contribute to the establishment of a both ecologically and economically sustainable space access for Europe (i.e. by reusable systems / components), which is oriented towards user needs (i.e. launch of several primary payloads to different dedicated orbits in one mission for a reasonable price).  The acronym vividly describes the core objective of promoting a new class of space scientists that are not only excellent specialists in their respective field, but who also have a thorough understanding for the complexity, multidisciplinary and internationality of launcher development in order to become leaders in the European effort of utilising space. The project leading to this application has received funding from the European Union‚Äôs Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Sk≈Çodowska-Curie grant agreement No 860956.

The European Commission‚Äôs Single European Sky (SES) initiative aims for the unification of European airspace. The creation of Functional Airspace Blocks such as FAB CE independent of national boundaries will optimise airspace usage and capacity, making the flow of air traffic over Europe more efficient.

Name: Delta-Utec Space
Company description: Delta-Utec is a Dutch space technology R&D company specialized in satellite (systems) design, systems engineering, simulations and space education. Delta-Utec provides consultancy via an expert network and provides Integrated Applications services (IAS), e.g. proposal writing support for the ESA IAP program (with near 100% success rate). Integrated Applications refers to the integration of the use of satellite (data) in your (terrestrial) application : e.g. in the field of sustainability, safe living, transport. We have developed and operated two small orbital missions (YES, 200 kg, in 1997; YES2, 32 kg, in 2007), helped initiate and design several others (TEAM by ESA in 1997, T-REX by JAXA in 2010) and developed numerous technologies and software tools: - space tether deployment technology (DU holds the world record for longest structure deployed in space at 32 km) - re-entry vehicle technology (heat shields, inflatables, parachute system, instrumentation, Fotino capsule) - mechanisms (ejection system, friction brake, release systems) - electronics (stepper driver, power distribution and on-board computing, sensors and data loggers) - star sensor algorithms and test environment - mission analysis and simulation tools - system engineering and PDM support tools - flight data analysis - mission feasibility studies - consultancy Since 1996 DU has worked with 115 interns and about 30 universities and 400 students worldwide. DU operate through a European network of small companies and universities.

Name: Flying Forward 2020

Company description: Flying Forward 2020 (FF2020) is a collaborative three-year research and innovation project funded by the European Union under the Horizon 2020 programme under grant agreement number 101006828. Our project is developing an entire state-of-the-art Urban Air Mobility (UAM) infrastructure by incorporating this new form of mobility within the geospatial digital infrastructure of cities. It includes a governance model and framework, a regulatory framework, a geospatial digital infrastructure, a Digital Toolbox, an Identity of Things (IDoT) scheme, and interoperability frameworks. The solutions developed during the project will be tested in five living labs across Europe: Eindhoven, Milan, Zaragoza, Tartu and Oulu ‚Äì enabling an open dialogue with stakeholders, end-users and citizens to improve processes and results. Ultimately, our goal is to have a positive and lasting impact on the quality of life of European citizens and to create sustainable partnerships and cities. Our consortium partners are: Brainport Development, Digie, EuroUSC Italia, High Tech Campus Eindhoven, INSPIR8ION, Maastricht University, Nalantis, San Raffaele Hospital, Serendipity, Tartu Science Park, University of Oulu, VERSES and Zaragoza City Council. Name: NEO-MAPP
Company description: NEO-MAPP project concentrates on two topics: a) Maturation or adaptation to specific use cases of existing modelling capabilities. b) Development of instruments, technologies and related data exploitation models to support NEO missions. Multiple communities are now interested in NEOs for very different reasons ranging from science to planetary defence and commercial objectives (e.g., mining, resource extraction & exploitation). Given the shared scientific and technological basis, all of these communities require knowledge and modelling capabilities of asteroid properties, as well as the capability to perform close proximity operations and make relevant measurements. The multi-disciplinary approach at the heart of NEO-MAPP is perfectly suited for providing the significant improvements required in each of these aspects. Building on the expertise of NEO-MAPP participants, who have been and are currently involved in small-body space missions as well as EC-funded NEO-related projects, the NEO-MAPP consortium is ideally set to further advance NEO scientific research and payload technologies. NEO-MAPP will not only address two of the three sub-topics indicated in the present call but will also dedicate considerable resources to developing important and innovative synergies between the two sub-topics. As such, NEO-MAPP will provide significant advances in our understanding of NEOs while at the same time build upon and sustainably increase expertise of European scientists and engineers in both planetary defence efforts and small-body exploration. The main goal of NEO-MAPP is to provide significant advances in both our understanding of the response of NEOs to external forces (in particular a kinetic impact or a close planetary approach), and in the associated measurements by a spacecraft (including those necessary for the physical and dynamical characterization in general).

Company description: O-boot develops in Germany an Italian patented sail system for HAPS (High Altitude Platform Systems) in order to 1) keep the HAPS in a quasi-geostationary position against the the high-altitude winds for one year by using very little energy 2) generate extra lift, which is extremely important in the stratosphere where the air is extremely thin 3) harness the high-altitude wind energy to power mobile broadband internet or video monitoring services day and night In this way, what have always been the two weak point of HAPS (the low power and little payload compared to orbital satellites like Starlink) become the two strong points of our Sailing HAPS, which will be much more powerful and performing than current orbital satellites, as well as less polluting

Name: Lupfe
Company description: At Lupfe, we work on an hybrid-electric propulsion system that provides suitable power density with significantly reduced fuel consumption to enable economical viable flight time and lifting capacity for electric vertical take-off and landing unmanned aircrafts.   Solving the problem of having simultanously high power density and low fuel consumption, our technology will increase duration of flight missions, flexibility of deployment and also improves environmentally responsible and economical operation.  This technology can cover performance technically from 60 kW to 300 kW at the base specific fuel consumption of 220-230 g/kWh using gasoline. Based on industrial demands, we develop performance to propulse eVTOL airframes roughly up to 750 kg maximum take-off weight. Altough all type of eVTOL airframes can use this technology, the most beneficial usage appears at multicopters where specific energy consumption is the highest and flight missions are characterised by frequent take-offs with relatively short flight distances.

Name: Carpatair
Company description: Founded in 1999, Carpatair is one of the oldest airlines in Romania with headquarters in Timisoara and presently a charter and wet lease airline having been operated in the aviation field for more than 25 years by 2024. First regular flights were launched from Cluj to Budapest and several destinations in northern Italy in spring 1999. Since then Carpatair operated on a regional hub & spoke system between 2000 and 2013 at Timisoara to destinations in seven countries in Eastern and Western Europe. From 2014 Carpatair switched its business model to non-scheduled services providing charter services and wet lease capacity operation on demand. Carpatair is proud of having been a trendsetter of just culture in Romania, the first airline in Romania and among the first in Eastern Europe to obtain the IOSA certification in 2005. Our mission is to be a top-quality charter and wet lease provider that caters for sports teams, orchestras, corporations, tour operators, organizations and governments and airline partners that require temporary or long-term capacity support. Whether on short or long-term projects, Carpatair will offer the expertise of a highly professional team with more than 25 years of experience in the industry that delivers tailor-made charter flight solutions at the best balance of costs, efficiency and reliability. Carpatair‚Äôs belief is that attention to detail, perseverance and devotion to client‚Äô needs is the key to customer satisfaction. Our mission and focus is to deliver to our clients a top service most efficiently and reliably, attentive to clients‚Äô needs.

Name: Qualiteit Consultancy
Company description: Mission: achieving safe, healthy and effective working conditions by performance based management Qualiteit Consultancy helps organizations with irregular working hours to comply with continuously changing legislation by translating the prescriptive rules into practice. Furthermore, Qualiteit Consultancy enables organizations to establish a continuous improvement process in favor of safety, productivity, absenteeism and employee satisfaction, by implementing a data- driven Fatigue Risk Management System. A fatigue Risk Management System is valuable for organizations characterized by shift work, since some of the most serious and persistent problems shift workers face are frequent sleep disturbance and associated excessive sleepiness. Sleepiness/fatigue in the work place can lead to poor concentration, absenteeism, accidents, errors, injuries, and fatalities.  Acknowledgment in European legislation: The need for a Fatigue Risk Management System is increasingly recognized within Europe and is already partially included in the Aviation Industry as a mandatory element in European legislation (EASA Flight Time Limitations, FTL). Based on 15 years of experience Qualiteit Consultancy can offer you the following products and/ or services: - ad interim project management  - complete implementation of a Fatigue Risk Management System, from  gap-analysis to approval - the development of Fatigue Risk Management training for both initial as recurrent training purposes - providing training concerning Fatigue Risk Management and Work and Rest rules, applicable for all   stakeholders involved  - documentation assurance - advice and support on the selection and implementation of Fatigue Risk Management software  - the implementation of prescriptive rules concerning work and rest requirements, including an impact   analysis, advice and an implementation plan - relation management with Authorities and other stakeholders involved
